value.Name: Western for the Elderly
value.Description: Western for the Elderly brings Western students with London’s elderly population in hopes to unite the two in sharing ideas, attending events and forming friendships. In a society with an ever aging population, we seek to ameliorate the lives of the elderly using the young, enthusiastic personalities that Western students maintain in order to decrease the loneliness of the elderly and by helping them with everyday tasks. Our events aim to build a relationship between Western students and London’s elderly in order to close the gap between the differing perspectives and hobbies that these two groups maintain and provide the opportunity for students to gain valuable experience volunteering at the affiliate long-term care homes.
value.Summary: Western for the Elderly organizes volunteering at a long term care home to connect Western students with London’s elderly population in hopes to unite the two in sharing ideas, attending events and forming friendships.

value.Name: University Students' Council
value.Summary: Your students' council

value.Name: DAN Management Students' Association
value.Description: The DAN Management Students’ Association (DMSA) is an association of business students at Western University that acts as the official liaison between the DAN Management program and the student body. We aim to unite business-minded individuals across campus and seek to provide valuable opportunities and resources to fuel professional and personal growth.
value.Summary: The DAN Management Students’ Association (DMSA) acts as the official liaison between the DAN Management program and the student body. We aim to unite business-minded individuals across campus and seek to fuel professional and personal growth.

value.Name: Dance Force - UWO
value.Description: Founded in 2004, UWO Dance Force commits its focus to fulfilling the hearts of local artists at the University of Western Ontario. With a team of 200 individuals, ranging from beginner to professional levels, Dance Force dedicates time to teaching, learning and perfecting the elements of technique, style and performance in dance. For more information email danceforce.club@westernusc.ca
value.Summary: Founded in 2004, UWO Dance Force commits its focus to fulfilling the hearts of local artists at the University of Western Ontario. With a team of 150 individuals, ranging from beginner to professional levels, Dance Force dedicates time to teaching, l…

value.Name: Gujarati Students' Association
value.Description: Gujarati Students Association strives to promote and celebrate Gujarati culture for both the students and faculty of Western University. We hope to provide a platform for students to become familiar with the Gujarati culture, overall contributing to the diversity at Western. Through traditional and non-traditional cultural events, we hope to create a strong network between Western and the local community.
value.Summary: Gujarati Students Association strives to promote and celebrate Gujarati culture for both the students and faculty of Western University.

value.Name: The Baking Club (Admin Use Only)
value.Description: Come one, come all!  Anyone and everyone that loves to bake or wants to learn some new things should join this club!  Hope to hear from you soon.  this cookie is for you!
value.Summary: Our mandate is to bake a variety of delicious treats and exchange recipes with other like-minded individuals.

value.Name: Black in STEM
value.Description: Black in STEM exists to create an inclusive environment for Black students within the STEM field. Through this club we hope to allow Black students to gain further insight about prospective career paths, offer networking opportunities, and post grad guidance in respective fields while reducing feelings of imposter syndrome that many may experience.
value.Summary: Black in STEM exists to create an inclusive environment for Black students within the STEM field.

value.Name: Muslim Students' Association
value.Description: The Muslim Students' Association (MSA) is one of the largest clubs on campus. The mission of the MSA is to provide an Islamic environment conducive to creativity, leadership, excellence and professionalism to empower students to reach their potential: physically, emotionally, socially, mentally and spiritually.
value.Summary: The Muslim Students' Association (MSA) is one of the largest clubs on campus. The mission of the MSA is to provide an Islamic environment conducive to creativity, leadership, excellence and professionalism to empower students to reach their potential…

value.Name: Caribbean Students Organization
value.Description:
The Caribbean Students’ Organization at Western University provides a home away from home for those from the Caribbean, as well as a link to your roots for those who have a Caribbean background.

Every year, Western's CSO hosts a Culture Show with the purpose of highlighting and celebrating the best of Caribbean Culture. While it is up to the club's members to determine what is showcased, CSO's primary goal is to ensure that all aspects of Caribbean Culture are equally highlighted though a diverse display of song, dance, food, and fashion.

It is our hope to raise awareness and educate both the Western community and wider London population on the culture of the region.

The annual Culture Show is the main event of CSO's Culture Show Weekend, which has been recently revamped to include a lecture, as well as a pre and after party for the show.

Our Mission: “To preserve Caribbean culture by educating the University of Western Ontario population while providing a spirited community for all West Indian students.”
value.Summary: The Caribbean Student's Organization provides a home away from home for those of Caribbean descent and works towards the enhancement of Western's knowledge of Caribbean culture.

value.Name: Newman Catholic Students
value.Description:
Welcome!

We are a group of Catholic Students committed to living out our faith and growing closer to Christ through His Church.

We do this through three ways: Community, Catechesis, and Evangelization

Community: Faith is not meant to be lived alone. We work to provide a chance for Catholics on campus to meet each other at our monthly social gatherings. We also regularly attend mass together at Christ the King University Parish at 5PM on Sunday nights.

Catechesis: It is important to grow in knowledge and understanding of our shared faith. We do this through attending mass together regularly and hosting small groups to go through CCO’s Faith Study series throughout the year.

Evangelization: We believe a critical aspect of the Catholic Faith is to spread the good news of Jesus. We do this by offering CCO’s Faith Studies, which are well suited to inviting participants who may not be Catholic themselves but are still open to learning about the faith.

We also aim to connect students with other Catholic events going on in London, such as King’s Campus Ministry and other events in the city.

If you are looking for other Catholics to hang out with and to be part of a community, you can get in touch through our Instagram page

Contact: The best way to stay up to date on socials, faith studies, and other events is through joining our Whatsapp chat. You can also find us on Instagram @Western.Newman.
value.Summary: The Newman Catholic Students' club are a group of young Catholic students committed to deepening our faith through community, catechesis, and evangelization. Find us at https://www.instagram.com/western.newman/

value.Name: Western Anime Club (Anime Video Explosion)
value.Description: Hi everyone! We are Western Anime Club and if you are a fan of anything anime, look no further, you’re already one of us!! Whether you’re a long-time fan, or someone who wants to see what anime is all about, Western Anime Club is HERE to make sure you can have lots of fun with others that have similar interests!! Our exec team this year has worked really hard to make sure fans from every corner of the anime world has a place in our club.
value.Summary: Western Anime Club's events focus on introducing various forms of Japanese animation to its members by showing and reviewing various programs and special features originally produced for a Japanese audience. The purpose of the club events is to provide…

value.Name: Black Future Lawyers Western
value.Description: BFL Western is a student-run club that aims to make a positive impact on members of Western’s Black community who are interested in gaining a broader understanding of a legal education and a career in law. As we recognize the systemic barriers that Black students face within the legal community, we strive to tackle those barriers by increasing access to exclusive vital resources such as roundtable discussions, presentations, panels and workshops, mentorship, and networking opportunities. Our chapter seeks to support, engage and connect Western's black students who are interested in becoming lawyers.
value.Summary: BFL Western is a student-run club that aims to make a positive impact on members of Western’s Black community who are interested in gaining a broader understanding of a legal education and a career in law.

value.Name: Pharmacology Club
value.Description: The UWO Pharmacology Club exists to serve undergraduate students interested in pharmacology related careers such as PharmD, MD, research and more. We provide opportunities for students to explore their interests by organizing post graduate information sessions, a speaker series with professors & professionals in the field​, online educational pharmacology content​, fundraisers and pharmacology-related wellness events with lots of giveaways!
value.Summary: The UWO Pharmacology Club provides opportunities and resources to undergraduate students interested in pharmacology careers (PharmD, MD, research and more) to pursue and achieve success in this field.

value.Name: Western Sneaker Club
value.Description: Everything Sneaker and Pop-Culture. Hosting sneaker photoshoots, social events, reselling opportunities and community fundraisers.
value.Summary: Everything Sneaker and Pop-Culture. Hosting sneaker photoshoots, social events, reselling opportunities and community fundraisers.

value.Name: Universities Allied for Essential Medicines
value.Description:
In 2001, a group of Yale University law students, together with Médecins Sans Frontières, helped convince Yale and the pharmaceutical company Bristol-Myers Squibb to permit generic production of a critical Yale-discovered HIV/AIDS drug in sub-Saharan Africa, triggering dramatic 30-fold price reductions. This was the first such concession on an HIV/AIDS drug; price cuts on other medications soon followed. This enabled a major scale-up of HIV treatment throughout the continent. The campaign showed those students that, as major contributors to drug development, universities are well positioned to influence the way medical technologies are developed and distributed, and thus can do much to help alleviate the access-to-medicines crisis.

What started as a small group of students at Yale University has now turned into a movement of more than 100 groups at universities in 18 countries around the globe, with strong coordination in Europe and Brazil and new chapters developing in India, Nepal and Tunisia, among other places.

As a non-profit organization rooted in a global movement of university students, UAEM aims to

(1) promote access to medicines and medical innovations in low- and middle-income countries by changing norms and practices around academic patenting and licensing, supported by our own independent research,

(2) ensure that university medical research meets the needs of people worldwide and

(3) empower students to respond to the access and innovation crisis.

As committed students from all over the world who passionately believe in social justice and health equity, we find it unacceptable that millions of people do not have access to essential medicines. We are particularly concerned about people in developing countries who are disproportionately affected by the access to medicines crisis.

Universities have a social compact with society and, as educational and research institutions, they have a responsibility to promote and manage the deployment of innovations for the public benefit. In no field are the moral imperatives to do so as clear as they are in medicine.

Students are uniquely positioned to push for normative change in their universities and research institutions. We will use the intellectual sophistication, rigor and integrity of our members to fight for increased innovation as well as access to medicines and health-related technologies for all.

Our work is guided at all times by principles of non-partisanship, democracy, transparency and respect.
value.Summary: UAEM Western is a group of students who find it unacceptable that millions around the world don't have access to essential medicines. We passionately believe in health equity and the role universities such as Western have in promoting equal access.

value.Name: Pangea
value.Description: Two hundred million years ago, Earth’s now seven continents existed as one. This supercontinent, Pangea, slowly drifted apart, ultimately creating the divided world we see today. Pangea Social Club is a multicultural organization that aims to unify students by bridging the cultural gap that exists within the Western community. Pangea strives to provide students of all different backgrounds, identities, and abilities with a safe and judgment-free environment through educational and social events. Pangea aims to form a global majority; A community with no borders and no limits.
value.Summary: Pangea is a multicultural social club that aims to unify students by bridging the cultural gap that exists within the Western community.

value.Name: Western Photography Club
value.Description: The Western Photography Club encompasses the full gamut of the imaging arts, from simple hobbyist photography with a smartphone to complex photoshoots using professional level equipment as well as techniques. We are a community that is inclusive of all photographers, regardless of skill, gear, or medium. You don't even need a dedicated camera to join, all you need is your smartphone! Through our workshops and hands-on photoshoots, you will have the opportunity to learn about everything you need to know to become an avid photographer. And of course, for those who know their way around photography, we offer leadership opportunities to organize complex and engaging photoshoots, a community of fellow photographers, and help with portfolio building through volunteer as well as paid photographic opportunities on campus and throughout London.
value.Summary: Want to be a part of a community of passionate photographers? Western Photography Club is the perfect fit for all levels of shutterbugs. We run tutorials, socials and even give you the opportunity to shoot University Events and Concerts. Join us today!

value.Name: Western Aviatrix
value.Description:
Welcome to Western Aviatrix!

Our goal is to connect people on campus who are passionate about aviation and ensuring an equitable, diverse, and inclusive place for everyone interested in aviation. We are working to encourage people to enter the aviation industry in any capacity they desire no matter what they look like or who they identify as. In aviation, under 20% of workers whether they be pilots, air traffic controllers, aircraft maintenance engineers, educators, or managers, among other roles in the industry identify as women. We also want to help other minorities including those identifying as BIPOC and also those part of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community feel like they belong in the aviation community as well. To do this, our club will host social events to help club members connect with one another and find people they can relate to. We will also put on informative education events with an aviation theme that club members can learn from. Finally, we will encourage club members to participate in various forms of community outreach to inspire youth and others looking to get involved in aviation.

Western Aviatrix is dedicated to all aviation enthusiasts on campus. Whether you are currently in the Commercial Aviation Management program, in another program but considering a career in the aviation industry, or you are here simply because you are fascinated by the aviation world, we would like to welcome you.

 

Our executive team:

Angel Abraham - President

Vanessa Waugh – VP Events 

Emily Luong – VP Communication

Rhea Kollias – VP Finance

Alysha Reddy – VP Membership

Maya Kumar – VP Administration
value.Summary: Western Aviatrix is the only club on campus that allows for people's collective passion for aviation to be brought together in a fully equitable, diverse, and inclusive way. Please see our constitution for more details on our initiatives and activities!

value.Name: Western Vinyl Club
value.Description: The Western Vinyl Club was created by music lovers for music lovers, with the intention of creating a positive environment for fans of all genres of music. Members can expect to participate in fun activities and events intended to broaden their music taste. The Western Vinyl Club is not only a place to discover and enjoy new music, but also a place to connect and make friends with fellow music fanatics.
value.Summary: Western Vinyl Club was created by music lovers for music lovers, with the intention of creating a positive environment for fans of all genres of music. Members can expect to participate in fun activities and events intended to broaden their music taste.

value.Name: Students' Human Ecology Association
value.Description: The Students’ Human Ecology Association (SHEA) is a student club, which aims to promote the personal and professional development of all Brescia & University of Western Ontario students with an interest in nutrition, dietetics, food science and technology, human ecology and family studies. The SHEA Executive Team plans and executes activities keeping within the philosophy, objectives and goals of all programs at Brescia. We recognize the importance of networking, professional development and leadership in order for students to be successful upon graduation. SHEA participates in an annual national student conference, organizes professional development workshops and events, provides volunteering opportunities which are directly related to students' career interests, leadership opportunities within the Executive Team, networking with professionals at the local, provincial and national levels, and social activities!
value.Summary: Students’ Human Ecology Association (SHEA) is a student club, which aims to promote the development of all Brescia & Western students with an interest in nutrition, dietetics, food science and technology, human ecology and family studies.

value.Name: Calligraphers of Western
value.Description:
This is a UWO club dedicated to raising and exposing East Asian culture through various styles of calligraphy. Both beginners experienced calligraphers are welcome. All lessons and materials are provided by the club.

We will be hosting weekly sessions and monthly events. This year, we will be bringing in professional calligraphers and may be hosting events together with other clubs (such as the tea club and the paper arts club).
value.Summary: This is a UWO club dedicated to raising and exposing East Asian culture through various styles of calligraphy. Both beginners experienced calligraphers are welcome. All lessons and materials are provided by the club.

value.Name: UWO Humanitarian Society
value.Description: UWO Humanitarian Society (previously Western Red Cross Club) works in partnership with the regional London/Middlesex Red Cross branch to fundraise and increase awareness for Humanitarian Crises acknowledged by the International and Canadian Red Cross Societies. We provide our members with a wide variety of volunteer opportunities within the London community. Our goal is to instill in the UWO community the fundamental principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement: Humanity, Impartiality, Neutrality, Independence, Voluntary Service, Unity and Universality.
value.Summary: UWO Humanitarian Society works in partnership with Canadian Red Cross to fundraise and increase awareness for humanitarian crises. We also provide our members with a wide variety of volunteer opportunities within the London community

value.Name: Western Environmental Business
value.Description:
With the climate crisis impacting more and more individuals on a global scale, Western Environmental Business (WEB) fosters a future generation of environmentally conscious business leaders and changemakers. Through our carefully curated programming of workshops to case comps, WEB strives to educate students on the intersections of business and sustainability. Students are encouraged to join as general members regardless of skill level or faculty. Come learn how to create a meaningful positive environmental impact!

The areas of business WEB focuses on includes sustainable:

- Entrepreneurship - Supply Chain Management - Consulting - Fashion & Retail - Non-Profit - Marketing - Social Finance - Real Estate (Green Infrastructure) - ESG Analytics
value.Summary: With the climate crisis impacting more and more individuals on a global scale, Western Environmental Business fosters a future generation of environmentally conscious business leaders and changemakers.

value.Name: Pre-Dental Society
value.Description: The Pre-Dental Society aims to help students learn more about dentistry and how to enter into this field. We help students prepare for their DAT, network with dentists and dental students, and introduce them to a variety of dental schools around the world.
value.Summary: The Pre-Dental Society aims to help students learn more about dentistry and how to enter into this field. We help students prepare for their DATs and introduce them to the different Dental schools from around the world.

value.Name: Women in STEM
value.Description: Women in STEM is an all-inclusive organization which offers a safe and encouraging environment for people of all genders and all academic backgrounds to explore their interests in STEM. By providing members with overarching opportunities and resources in all four disciplines of STEM we aim to equip members with the skills required to succeed in their personal and professional endeavours. Throughout the year, Women In STEM members can participate in an array of events and programs including our flagship Toronto Firm Trip, our monthly newsletter, our We Solve Case Competition, among other events, workshops, and socials.
value.Summary: Women in Stem focuses on the professional development of our members in STEM fields.

value.Name: Arab Students Association
value.Description: The Western Arab Students’ Association is a Western club that unites students through Arab culture. At the ASA, we believe that diversity is our unity. We provide a place to learn about our diverse cultures, their people, and their values.
value.Summary: The Arab Students’ Association is a place to learn about our diverse cultures, the people, and their values.

value.Name: Duke of Edinburghs Club
value.Description:
The Western Duke of Edinburgh's Club was created to give UWO students an avenue to begin and complete their involvement with the Internationally recognized Duke of Edinburgh Award. The club facilitates and encourages students to grow their interests through individually oriented skill development, community service, physical fitness and expeditions/explorations. Within the purpose of the club is to form a social environment that brings together students with similar interests, creating an atmosphere of encouragement, experience sharing, and dedication. The club will facilitate networking between our club members and other local, national, and international organizations. 

The award is achieved by students making a bimonthly commitment to take part in physical recreation, community volunteering, and personal skill development of their choice. The award is internationally recognized for developing individuals who are dedicated, interesting, and active within their communities. It leaves requirements open-ended for students to decide their activities based upon their interests, and it also allows students to complete the award at their own pace. The Western Duke of Edinburgh's Club is meant for UWO students to become involved, build a strong campus community, and to develop their own personal interests through this unique opportunity.
value.Summary: The Western Duke of Edinburgh's Club was created to give UWO students an avenue to begin and complete their involvement with the Internationally recognized Duke of Edinburgh Award.

value.Name: Hellenic Society
value.Description: Those sunsets and white sea-side buildings you see on Instagram, that’s just scratching the surface of the beauty of Greece. The Hellenic Society is a USC-ratified club running for over 25 years, bringing together Western students of all backgrounds to enjoy the food, music, and most importantly the social connection that Greek culture offers. From our biggest end of year social event with all European clubs called Euro Night, to dinners and bowling, our club offers a fun and welcoming environment that you don’t want to miss out on! Come meet some amazing fellow Western students, opa!
value.Summary: The Hellenic Society is a USC-ratified club running for over 25 years, bringing together Western students of all backgrounds to enjoy the food, music, and most importantly the social connection that Greek culture offers.

value.Name: Western Knit and Crochet Club
value.Description:
Western Knit and Crochet is a community of like-minded yarn enthusiasts. This is a place for knitters and crocheters of all skill levels to unite under a shared passion! WKCC is an inclusive space for students interested in knitting and crocheting to form friendships and de-stress by creating anything from stuffed animals to bags and blankets.

The club invites everyone, provides all resources, and is a great way to get involved in the school and local community. Look forward to weekly meetings, seasonal events, and volunteer opportunities!

If you're looking to pick up a new skill, gain friends, or simply find a place to relax, join WKCC!
value.Summary: Western Knit and Crochet is a community of like-minded yarn enthusiasts. This is a place for knitters and crocheters of all skill levels to unite under a shared passion!

value.Name: Concussion Awareness Society
value.Description:
The goals of the Concussion Awareness Society at Western University are to provide the public with educational resources and to provide an open forum for collaboration to encourage the generation of new and innovative ideas and solutions for concussion treatment.

Ultimately, we want to see Western students coming together in support of the university's world-renowned researchers in their pursuit of understanding this debilitating injury.
value.Summary: The goals of the Concussion Awareness Society at Western University are to provide the public with educational resources and to provide an open forum for collaboration to encourage the generation of new and innovative ideas and solutions for concussion.

value.Name: Spectrum UWO
value.Description:
Spectrum is a student-run club that aims to bring students together for the common goal of building a safe space for LGBTQIA+ students and allies on campus. Our goal is to create a social network through various events and socials throughout the year where students can feel like themselves.

From arts and crafts, and game nights to study sessions and wellness events, Spectrum UWO has something for you.
value.Summary: Spectrum is a club dedicated to providing social events for LGBTQIA+ and Queer students on campus and creating connections within the LGBTQIA+ community at Western.

value.Name: Western Art Club
value.Description: WAC provides all undergraduate students, regardless of their artistic abilities, with the opportunity to participate in multiple art and craft workshops throughout the year. Students will be able to socialize with others who have a similar interest in the visual arts, and create a tangible product by the end of each workshop.
value.Summary: WAC provides all undergraduate students, regardless of their artistic abilities, with an opportunity to participate in multiple art and craft workshops throughout the year.

value.Name: Students for Eating Disorder Awareness
value.Description: The purpose of this club is to raise awareness about eating disorders; provide a safe space for people to come together where there is shared culture of safety, understanding, and empathy; bring awareness to the resources that exist off campus to support students; and advocate for on-campus services and support.
value.Summary: The Western Eating Disorder Awareness Club exists to educate and raise awareness surrounding the mental health issue of eating disorders.

value.Name: Ismaili Students Association
value.Description: The Western Ismaili Students Association is comprised of UWO students of the Shia Ismaili Muslim faith. WISA is a university-sanctioned club that promotes community building amongst both Ismailis and non-Ismailis alike at UWO and the city of London. We value hard work, integrity and fun while aspiring towards academic, social, cultural and physical well-being.
value.Summary: The Western Ismaili Students' Association is comprised of UWO students that are mostly of the Shia Ismaili Muslim faith. The WISA is a university-sanctioned club that promotes community building amongst both Ismailis and non-ismailis alike at UWO and…

value.Name: Western Sikh Students Association
value.Summary: A friendly environment for Sikh students to come together, attend various social/charitable events and be involved in the community.  Discussion about religion, spirituality, and world events are also encouraged.

value.Name: Turkic Cultural Club
value.Description: Welcome to the Turkic Cultural Club (TCC) at Western University. TCC is a platform dedicated to exploring the diverse traditions of Turkic countries, highlighting the unique cultural nuances each nation brings. From traditional showcases to language workshops, we delve into the rich tapestry of Turkic heritage. While our focus is on the various Turkic traditions, we extend an open invitation to individuals from all backgrounds who are interested in the exploration and appreciation of cultural diversity! Join TCC for an insightful journey through the distinct traditions of Turkic countries – everyone is welcome!
value.Summary: The Turkic Cultural Club (TCC) is a platform dedicated to exploring the diverse traditions of Turkic countries, highlighting the unique cultural nuances each nation brings.

value.Name: Game Design Society
value.Description:
View our Linktree! (With our Discord server).

Game Design Society (GDS) is a community for exciting discussions about design, development, and the joy of games.

GDS strives to unite students from diverse backgrounds, all with a passion for game design and development. No matter one’s skill level or involvement in the industry, we want everyone to build their ability and create a supportive network. Through social, educational, and networking events - anyone can meet new people and create all types of games.

In sum, we strive to give skills, forge a community of game development enthusiasts, and give inspiration and opportunity to create and learn. 

No matter your background. No matter what skills you have. We would love for you to come and join us!
value.Summary: Game Design Society (GDS) is a community for exciting discussions surrounding passions for design, development, and the joy of games. GDS strives to unite students through social, educational, and networking events.

value.Name: Habitat for Humanity UWO
value.Description: Habitat for Humanity UWO seeks to assist the local affiliate and affiliates around the world. WE DONATE, PARTICIPATE AND ADVOCATE.Donations are crucial for every Habitat build, and we seek to give what we can to every project we are involved in.Participation occurs when we help construct homes, volunteer in the Re-Store, or assist the organization in any way on a build site. Advocacy is paramount; in order to solve the problem of affordable housing people must be made aware of the need for it. Our primary goals are to: Work with the local London affiliate toward the goal of building homes; Provide opportunities for students to learn and teach while participating in builds locally and abroad; Bring our message to the community especially the youth of London.
value.Summary: Habitat for Humanity UWO seeks to assist the local affiliate and affiliates around the world. WE DONATE, PARTICIPATE AND ADVOCATE. Donations are crucial for every Habitat build, and we seek to give what we can to every project we are involved in.

value.Name: Brescia Multicultural Association
value.Description: Celebrating cultures across all campuses, while upholding Brescia’s rich multicultural history.
value.Summary: Celebrating cultures across all campuses, while upholding Brescia’s rich multicultural history.

value.Name: Society of Serbian Students - Saint Sava
value.Description: The Society of Serbian Students - Saint Sava is a student run club. Our goal is to promote Serbian culture within the Western University community. We host various events and immersive experiences on and off campus that showcase Serbian traditions, faith, food, music and language. We welcome students of all backgrounds who wish to learn about, appreciate and participate in the various aspects of Serbian culture.
value.Summary: Our goal is to promote Serbian culture within the Western University community. We host various events and immersive experiences on and off campus that showcase Serbian traditions, food, music and language.

value.Name: A Cappella Association of Western
value.Description:
Hi everyone! Welcome to the A Cappella Association of Western University. Here at ACA-Western, we have three amazing a cappella groups for you to join. Here's a bit about them...

The A Cappella Project (TAP) is our non-competitive, co-ed a cappella group. It serves as open forum for those interested in singing, arranging, and beatboxing. Tap accepts members regardless of experience, and hope to improve members' vocal techniques and performance skills. TAP is ACA's largest group!

Equivox is our competitive, co-ed a cappella group. Founded in 2017, Equivox has gone on to perform at the ICCA quarterfinals twice, as well as the Queen's University Annual A Cappella competition. You can join Equivox by audition!

Repercussions is a competitive, all-female a cappella group that has performed at the ICCAs (International Collegiate Championships of A Cappella) as well as been accepted to the Queens University Annual A Cappella Competition. You can join Repercussions by audition! 

It is worth noting that members in our competitive groups typically have considerable musical experience and a lot of time to dedicate to a cappella rehearsals, competitions, and more.
value.Summary: We are an organization hoping to enrich the A Cappella culture at Western University. We have multiple vocal groups, which are open to all students, and cater to different musical abilities varying from beginners to musically experienced individuals.

value.Name: Israel On Campus
value.Description: If you can't spend next year in Jerusalem, we've got the next best thing. Israel on Campus brings the homeland a little closer to home. We are a group of Western students who are united in our proud support of Israel, and our interest in giving Western a chance to learn more about Israel's people, culture, politics, and life. In the last couple of years, We hosted big name speakers to packed audiences.We raised money for Israeli charities.We hosted a concert of Israel's biggest hip-hop band.We ran letter-writing campaigns in support of Israel.We taught students Krav Maga, the Israeli martial art.We held weekly Hebrew lessons.We held seminars on Israel advocacy.We stood up in support of Israel whenever and wherever necessary.And we held Western's biggest cultural awareness day Israel Day. What are we going to do this year? You'll have to wait and see. But, we can guarantee that we'll be standing alongside the little state that could and continue to bring a little piece of Israel to Western. Am Yisrael Chai!
value.Summary: If you can't spend next year in Jerusalem, we've got the next best thing. Israel on Campus brings the homeland a little closer to home. We are a group of Western students who are united in our proud support of Israel, and our interest in giving Weste…

value.Name: Western Indo-Canadian Students Association
value.Description: Western Indo-Canadian Students' Association is a student-run, non-profit organization sanctioned by the University of Western Ontario in London, Ontario. WICSA has been organizing cultural, social, academic, and philanthropic events for over 30 years, making it one of the oldest of its kind. Since its establishment in 1983, WICSA has grown to become an organization with a strong sense of community. From founding Sitaron Ki Mehfil, an inter-university dance competition and cultural show comprising of acts from university students across the province, to organizing our annual Charity Basketball Tournament, to many other smaller networking based events. Through these events WICSA provides our members with a sense of family and culture while away from home.
value.Summary: WICSA is Western's biggest South Asian organization, established in 1983. We are dedicated to providing a our members with a variety of experiences and events, while celebrating our culture and cultivating a strong sense of community.

value.Name: Western Psychology Association
value.Description: The WPA is for any student with an interest in psychology. We hold social, academic, and volunteer events, and are always looking for enthusiastic members to participate! If you're a psych student at Western, the WPA is your best possible resource.
value.Summary: The WPA is for any student with an interest in psychology.  We hold social, academic, and volunteer events, and are always looking for enthusiastic members to participate!  If you're a psych student at Western, the WPA is your best possible resource.

value.Name: Women in Fitness
value.Description: Women in Fitness (WIF) is an organization for Western students who identify as a woman who have a passion for physical fitness and healthy eating. The goal of WIF is to motivate, educate, and encourage its members in their fitness journey to be the healthiest they can be through exercise, food and community. Participation can be weekly or monthly with events such as a trying out a group exercise class, participating as a team in a charity run/walkathon, attending guest speaker sessions (nutritionists, personal trainers, cooking class, etc), all focused on creating a community of friends to ask questions, share recipes and nutrition knowledge, encourage exercise, and support each other.
value.Summary: Women in Fitness (WIF) is an organization for Western students who identify as a woman who have a passion for physical fitness and healthy eating.

value.Name: Western Wildlife Conservation Society
value.Description:
Western Wildlife Conservation Society is comprised of dedicated students who are passionate about nature preservation and animal rehabilitation both locally and globally. We emphasize the importance of wildlife through campus-wide events and unique volunteering opportunities.

As a member, you will gain access to all our events and opportunities, including:

  • Conservation presentations brought to you by Salthaven Animal Rehabilitation Centre
  • Zero-waste workshops
  • Wildlife Interaction events
  • Outdoor Activities (e.g. Nature Walk, Tree Planting)
  • Volunteer Opportunities (e.g. River clean-ups)
  • Social Events (e.g. Bar Nights, Coffeehouse, Trivia Night)
  • And more!

Join WWCS if you’re interested in meeting liked-minded people and making friends (humans too!). We look forward to seeing you at our events!
value.Summary: The purpose of the Western Wildlife Conservation Society is to raise awareness about a healthy, diverse, and ultimately sustainable living Earth.

value.Name: Smart Solutions
value.Description: Smart Solutions Western is a social justice club that seeks to engage members and create opportunities to volunteer throughout the London community. This year, our overarching focus is the alleviation of poverty through discussion and further awareness. Some topics of discussion will be but not limited to, micro-loans, women empowerment, and institutional inequalities. We will not only look at the micro-aspects of poverty but also will evaluate macro-causations, through keynote speakers, documentaries, and practical applications.  We have various opportunities for new member leadership roles and development.
value.Summary: Smart Solutions Western offers students who are passionate about world issues a platform to discuss, learn, & create innovative solutions to world problems. We hope to find solutions for poverty alleviation both locally and globally.

value.Name: Polish Students' Union
value.Description: Our goal is to cultivate polish roots and traditions, and to foster a sense of community by bringing together all people of Polish and non-Polish origin attending Western University. To afford all union members with the opportunity to meet new people and engage in social activities designed for their enjoyment and benefit. To foster a sense of pride in union members in the accomplishments of the Polish people and the nation of Poland.
value.Summary: Our goal is to cultivate polish roots and traditions, and to foster a sense of community by bringing together all people of Polish and non-Polish origin attending Western University. To afford all union members with the opportunity to …

value.Name: Canadian-Italian Appreciation Organization
value.Description:
Ciao ragazzi!

Welcome to CIAO - Western University's Canadian-Italian Appreciation Organization! Our goal is to explore the Italian culture together with Western students and bring a little piece of Italy to the Western Community. Throughout the year we will feature a variety of Italian themed events, and we encourage all members to keep informed through our Instagram (@ciaowestern) and Facebook (CIAO Western)

A presto,

Your CIAO Exec Team
value.Summary: Western University's Canadian-Italian student association! Bringing a taste of Italian culture, language, and food to the students of Western.

value.Description:
For inquiries, comments, concerns or more information on any FHSSC initiatives, please feel free to contact the appropriate portfolio:

President: Emma Knechtel eknechte@uwo.ca

VP Events: Zoravar Sidhu zsidhu@uwo.ca

VP Communications: Hannah Min hmin23@uwo.ca
