value.Description: Western University Korean Students' Association (WUKSA) is a club that strives to create a forum for all Korean students and anyone interested in Korean culture, across all faculties and undergraduate student bodies. Our executive team also aims to bring Korean culture and identity closer to the Western community to promote and celebrate diversity and multiculturalism. Facilitating academic, social and professional development of our members is central to our mission.
value.Summary: Western University Korean Students' Association (WUKSA) is a club that strives to create a forum for all Korean students and anyone interested in Korean culture, across all faculties and undergraduate student bodies.

value.Name: Western Capital Markets
value.Description:
Western Capital Markets is a club dedicated to working with the general members that are hesitant to dip their feet into Capital Markets by giving them the knowledge they need to succeed. Additionally, we work towards fine tuning the skills of seasoned students that have prior knowledge.

We take a student-oriented, hands-on approach to investing and combine it with a comprehensive, student-created, education resource library for our members.

Resources are available through our website, and the executive team can be easily contacted and are here to help.
value.Summary: Western Capital Markets is a club dedicated to working with the most hesitant beginners and giving them the knowledge they need to succeed, as well as to fine tuning the skills of seasoned professionals.  We take a student-oriented, hands…

value.Name: Pre-Medical Society
value.Description: The UWO Pre-Medical Society encourages interest in the medical profession through academic and social programming as well as by providing community and medically-related volunteer opportunities in London and overseas. The UWO Pre-Medical Society offers information about everything you need to know about preparing for and applying to medical school. Members have access to exclusive information sessions on topics such as information on various medical schools from Ontario, Canada, North-America and around the World, as well as information on writing the MCAT and interview preparation. A close working relationship with students in the Schulich School of Medicine also allows club members to obtain relevant first-hand knowledge on applying to and attending medical school. The Pre-Medical Society also offers its members substantial discounts on MCAT preparation courses through partnerships with the Princeton Review.
value.Summary: The UWO Pre-Medical Society encourages interest in the medical profession through academic and social programming as well as by providing community and medically-related volunteer opportunities in London and overseas. The UWO Pre-Medical Society offe…

value.Name: HanVoice Western
value.Description:
HanVoice is the largest Canadian non-profit organization focused on advancing the North Korean human rights cause by supporting on-the-ground information dissemination and working with leading politicians and policy experts to create change on the international stage. 

 

HanVoice aspires for a North Korea where its citizens do not flee their country in search of food and freedom. We are driven to enhance the role Canada and its government plays in bringing human rights and humanitarian assistance to North Korea to enable the change necessary for a free and prosperous country.
value.Summary: HanVoice is Canada's largest non-profit organization driven to enhance the role of Canada and its government in bringing human rights and humanitarian assistance to North Korea to enable the change necessary for a free and prosperous country.

value.Name: Purple Spur Society
value.Description: The largest club at Western whose mandate is to maintain and foster the Spirit of Western, support varsity athletics, and facilitate wicked-awesome social interaction among all Mustangs.
value.Summary: The largest and oldest club at Western, whose members are dedicated to maintaining and fostering the Spirit of Western, supporting varsity athletics, helping our community, and facilitating amazing social interaction among all Mustangs.

value.Name: Western Firearms Association
value.Description: WFA is a club designed to teach and promote safe firearm use to students at Western.
value.Summary: WFA is a club designed to teach and promote safe firearm use to students at Western.

value.Name: Romanian Students Association
value.Description: Buna tuturor! As the RSA at Western, our goal is to bring Romanian students together to celebrate our native roots and culture through various social events. Whether you want to meet students sharing a similar background or learn more about Romania and our customs, the RSA is the place for you. Through this club, we wish to bring a piece of Romania to the Western community as we continue to honour our traditions and our beautiful country.
value.Summary: The RSA at Western provides students with the opportunity to connect with others sharing similar roots or interests in Romanian culture and customs.

value.Name: Western Stem Cell Club
value.Description: WSSC works to improve the chances that patients in-need of stem cell transplantation will find the match they need to save their lives.  Our work also aims to advance Canada's blood health through blood donor recruitment and by supporting the activities of Canadian Blood Services. WSSC trains its members to advocate for patients requiring stem cell transplants, all while developing leadership and teamwork skills in the process.
value.Summary: WSSC aims to improve the quality and quantity of membership on Canada’s stem cell donor database by organizing and running stem cell drives on campus and in the London community.

value.Name: New Democratic Party Western
value.Description: NDP Western's aim is to promote progressive values on campus and around London. To this end, the club facilitates events, campaigns and socials to support progressive causes while encouraging greater youth engagement with politics. Events often feature sitting MPPs and other local progressive politicians to allow Mustangs to interact with present and future political leaders. We maintain close ties with the Provincial (Marit Stiles) and Federal (Jagmeet Singh) formations of the social-democratic NDP. Membership and activities are open to all - you do not need an NDP membership to participate!
value.Summary:
NDP Western's aim is to promote progressive values on campus and around London. The club hosts a number of events and talks intended to promote debate and awareness of political and social issues.

Interested? Join our Discord server via our Linktree!

value.Name: Brazilian Student Association at Western
value.Description: Western University’s local BRASA is affiliated with the BRASA international organization, and focuses on promoting the Brazilian culture to all students and facilitating connections among Brazilian students. BRASA UWO will host various social and academic events throughout the year in order to enrich the student experience by promoting cross-cultural understanding, fostering friendships, and equipping our members with the global perspective and skills needed to thrive in an interconnected world. Our mission is for BRASA UWO to bring students together and create lifelong friendships with those who share the same love for Brazil. BRASA UWO is committed to make Western University a vibrant and welcoming place for all, enhancing the student experience by celebrating diversity, promoting cultural exchange, and creating a more inclusive and globally aware campus community.
value.Summary: Western University’s local BRASA is affiliated with the BRASA international organization, and focuses on promoting the Brazilian culture to all students and facilitating connections among Brazilian students.

value.Name: Western Energy and Resource Club
value.Description: We aim to provide information to interested students about the social, financial, and political aspects that are intertwined within the energy and resource sectors while creating a forum for members to build relationships and interpersonal skills that will bring them success in the energy and resource sectors, or their respective paths.
value.Summary: We aim to provide information to interested students about the social, financial, and political aspects that are intertwined within the energy and resource sectors while creating a forum for members to build relationships and interpersonal skills.

value.Name: Sri Lankan Students' Alliance
value.Description: SLSA is a cultural club dedicated to educating both Western and the London community about the unique history and diverse cultures of Sri Lanka. It is open to everyone with an interest in learning about Sri Lanka and meeting new people.
value.Summary: SLSA is a cultural club dedicated to educating both Western and the London community about the unique history and diverse cultures of Sri Lanka. It is open to everyone with an interest in learning about Sri Lanka and meeting new people.

value.Name: Students Fight Parkinsons
value.Description:
Students Fight Parkinson's (SFP) is a student-run group, established in 2010 at Western University. We work to raise awareness for Parkinson disease and funds for the Parkinson Society Southwestern Ontario. Membership is open to all undergraduate students.

Mission Statement

  • To raise awareness of the effect Parkinson's disease has on patients, their families, and their friends
  • To raise money for the Parkinson Society Southwestern Ontario for Parkinson Disease Research
  • To create solidarity between the students of Western University and people with Parkinson's in the greater London community
value.Summary: Students Fight Parkinson's (SFP) is a student-run group, established in 2010 at Western University. We work to raise awareness for Parkinson disease and funds for the Parkinson Society Southwestern Ontario.

value.Name: Operation Smile Students Association
value.Description: Operation Smile is a non-profit club that supports medical volunteers to repair children's cleft lips and cleft palates. More than 200,000 children are born with a severe cleft condition each year -- often unable to eat, speak, sociailize or smile. In some places these children are shunned and rejected. And in too many cases, their parents can't afford to give them the surgeries they need to live a healthy life. For only $240, Operation Smile can change a child's life by giving the gift of surgery. With your help, how many lives can we change tomorrow?
value.Summary: Operation Smile is a non-profit club that supports medical volunteers to repair children's cleft lips and cleft palates. For only $240, Operation Smile can change a child's life by giving the gift of surgery.

value.Name: Asian Christian Fellowship
value.Description: We are a club that exists to bring glory to God in all that we do, whether it be through retreats, guest speakers, worship, bible studies or games nights.  Our goal is to build Christ-centered relationships with one another and grow together in our understanding of Christ through our various ministries.  We meet every Friday night at 7pm in B&GS room 0153 so feel free to come join us whenever you can; everyone is welcome!
value.Summary: A place of fellowship for followers of Christ.  We are a club that exists to bring glory to God in all that we do.  Our goal is to build Christ-centered relationships with one another and grow together in our understanding of Christ.

value.Name: Faculty Science Students Council
value.Description:
Striving to help each Western University science undergraduate achieve the best student experience possible. Science Students' Council is composed of 57 members of the science community, including elected representatives that serve as your voice within our supporting Faculties, and appointed commissioners responsible for improving your undergraduate experience. We are your link to the University Students' Council, the University Senate and the various departments within the Faculty of Science and the Schulich School of Medicine and Dentistry.

Find out more at westernssc.ca
value.Summary: Striving to help each Western science undergraduate achieve the best student experience possible.

value.Name: Western Rehab Club
value.Description: Western Rehab Club (WRC) looks to foster a supportive network of like-minded students at Western University who are interested in or want to learn more about the field of rehabilitation. Through this community, WRC aims to build a space on campus where members with similar passions can share resources, build knowledge, and develop lasting relationships. WRC looks to expose students to the different fields and practices within rehab through mentorship, networking, and learning events and opportunities.
value.Summary: Western Rehab Club (WRC) looks to foster a supportive network of like-minded students at Western University who are interested in or want to learn more about the field of rehabilitation.

value.Name: Western Strength
value.Description: Western Strength is a friendly, active community built around all things fitness and nutrition. As a registered Ontario Powerlifting Association club, we have proudly represented Western University at Provincial, National, and International Powerlifting competitions since 2017. We host various social events, intercollegiate competitions, and educational workshops for all members to enjoy. Whether you are a seasoned powerlifter or just beginning your fitness journey, our network of athletes will be there to support you in becoming stronger in every sense of the word.
value.Summary: Western Strength is a friendly, active community that aims to develop services and events informed by our members' fitness interests and strength goals.

value.Name: Autism Awareness Western
value.Description: Autism Awareness Western aims to educate Western constituents on Autism, along with engaging Autistic individuals at Western and the greater London community. With passionate membership, our club aims to provide an environment for students to collaboratively work towards removing the social stigma associated with Autism, as well as supporting individuals on the spectrum through planning sensory-friendly events. As a club, we hope to provide a safe atmosphere where members can learn about Autism, while promoting understanding and acceptance.
value.Summary:
Mission
Autism Awareness Western aims to educate Western constituents on Autism, along with engaging and supporting Autistic individuals at Western and in the London community.

value.Name: London Chinese Catholic Community
value.Description:
Welcome to London Chinese Catholic Community!

   Despite the name of our group, we actually welcome anyone who are interested in the Roman Catholic faith. It does not matter whether you are Chinese or not, as a matter of fact, you do not even have to be Catholic and we would still welcome you to our family!
   We are a historical student group situated in the University of Western Ontario with over 30 years of history. LCCC was found by a group of Chinese students whose goal was to create a safe haven of sort that would allow Catholics and Non-Catholics to explore the Catholic faith and support one another.
     As one of the officially recognized clubs by the University Student Association, LCCC follows the Catholic mission of evangelization and outreach to support the Chinese Catholics on campus.
     Our group has weekly gatherings that celebrate our faith through discussions, sharings, prayers and singspiration. Moreover, we also have weekly social gatherings that provide our members with opportunties to get to know one another better, in turn strengthening our bonds as friends and family.
value.Summary: We are a Catholic community; we share our thoughts and practice our faith together in society. We support each other, and walk the faith journey together!

value.Name: Pre-Veterinary Society
value.Description: The UWO Pre-Veterinary Society is a club for students interested in veterinary medicine, research, and other animal-related fields. We strive to provide opportunities to help our members fulfill the requirements for veterinary school.
value.Summary: The UWO Pre-Veterinary Society is a club for students interested in veterinary medicine, research, and other animal-related fields.  We strive to provide opportunities to help our members fulfill the requirements for veterinary school.

value.Name: Western Soccer Association
value.Description:
Hey Western! Ready to experience soccer fever like NEVER before? ⚡ Welcome to THE ultimate soccer hub at Western! This year is going to be BIG with an electrifying lineup of 45 events – that's a goal every week!

 

Membership? 🎫 A no-brainer! We’ve dropped it to the lowest possible price ($5.00), but guess what? Our massive community of soccer lovers ensures we've got the funds to deliver jaw-dropping events & MASSIVE prizes!

 

⚽ Dive into the Universe of Soccer with us:

 

 

🔥 Play Mode On: Jump in for weekly pick-up/drop-in sessions all through fall!

 

🏆 Tournaments: Challenge yourself in our monthly 7v7 tournaments & fight to win our iconic WSA trophy!

 

🍿 Spectator Mode: Sit back, relax & enjoy the big games throughout the year with us!

 

🚌 COME WATCH MESSI: Toronto beckons as we witness TFC challenge Lionel Messi & his Inter Miami side!

 

🍺 Social Butterfly? Mingle at our bar nights or join one of our intramural teams as a free agent!

 

🤓 Nerd Nights: Trivia, jeopardy, and more – all without having to break a sweat!

 

💜 Make a Difference: Help out your community during our charity events!

 

⚡ Skill Up: Elevate your game with training sessions led by varsity giants and compete in our skill challenges!

 

🎮 FIFA Masters: Show off at our monthly EA FC 24 tournaments!

 

📊 Football Guru: Dive deep into analytics & challenge yourself with fantasy teams, match predictions & tournament brackets!

 

🎁 Membership Perks: Save $5 on ALL paid events! Just one event & your membership pays for itself – then you're scoring savings on every one after that!

 

 

💰 Where's Your Money Going? Our 26 dedicated execs are here volunteering their magic, ensuring every penny levels up your experience! Expect larger venues, drool-worthy catering, epic prizes, and FREE events (yes, you heard right – from FIFA tourneys to drop-in soccer and more)!

 

📣 Huge shoutout for tuning in! 🙌 Can't wait to see you making waves at Clubs Week and all our events. Check out our LinkTree for our socials, event sign-up forms, director applications, mailing list registration, and our tentative events schedule! 

 

🔥 Score big by joining WSA!!
value.Summary: The Western Soccer Association strives to hit on every facet of the beautiful game to provide members with the best all-around experience. This ranges from numerous playing opportunities to watching games at the Spoke, and everything in between!

value.Name: University of Western Ontario Hong Kong Student Association
value.Description: Welcome to the Hong Kong Students’ Association! We welcome all Hong Kong students and anyone who’s interested in learning about Hong Kong culture to join us. Ranging from Social Circles to practice your Cantonese skills, to the long-awaited Dim Sum Market, our goal is to bring authentic Hong Kong experiences to the Western community. We hope to provide students with a comfortable and safe space to socialize and support one another as we celebrate Hong Kong culture. We are so excited to have you in our HKSA family!
value.Summary: University of Western Ontario Hong Kong Student Association (UWOHKSA) is the only social club desire to gather and unite all Cantonese-speakers in Western.

value.Name: Run With Us
value.Description:
Run With Us is a recreational running club that promotes both mental and physical health on campus. We welcome all members regardless of skill level or experience, there is a spot for everyone!

 

We strive to create a community of students that support one another's well-being. Our goal is to improve and promote the awareness of mental and physical health throughout campus through running. Our events include weekly runs across campus, as well educationals regarding mental and physical health.
value.Summary: Run With Us is a recreational run club that brings together the running community at Western University. All levels of runners are welcome!

value.Name: Nova Scientia - New Science
value.Description: Nova Scientia is an academic focused club. We share and discuss our experiences of daily school life and try to help each other stand in a stronger position when acquiring new knowledge. We firmly believe knowlege crowns those who seek it and we as student should  never stop exploring and sharing. Although most of our discussions are online hold through blogs and social medias, we also hold regular study group events to help our members develop better learning habits and therefore indirectly help them to achieve better academic results.
value.Summary: Nova Scientia is an academic focused club. We share and discuss our experiences of daily school life and try to help each other stand in a stronger position when acquiring new knowledge.

value.Name: Marathi Student's Organization
value.Description: The Marathi Student’s Organization is a diverse and inclusive university club that warmly welcomes Marathi students and anyone interested in learning about Marathi culture. Our inclusive space offers a platform for Marathi students of all backgrounds to come together, share their experiences, and celebrate their culture. We aim to create a friendly and lively community where people from all backgrounds can join together to celebrate our shared heritage. Through engaging cultural events and workshops, we foster connections among our members. Whether you're a Maharashtrian or simply interested in exploring Marathi culture, we invite you to join us in embracing the richness and diversity of our cultural identity at Western.
value.Summary: The Marathi Student’s Organization is a diverse and inclusive university club that warmly welcomes Marathi students and anyone interested in learning about Marathi culture. Our inclusive space offers a platform for Marathi students of all backgrounds.

value.Name: Active Minds Western
value.Description:
Active Minds’ mission is to reduce the stigma that surrounds mental illness and to create an open environment for the discussion of mental health issues. Our aim is to raise awareness and spark meaningful conversations about mental health. By fighting the stigma that surrounds mental illness, our hope is that individuals will become better educated and more comfortable with their own mental health. Through a variety of events and advocacy initiatives we build a community of passionate individuals within the club and collectively raise awareness among Western University students. Join our “Brainy Bunch” this year and lets make mental wellness a priority on campus!

Check out our Link Tree for more info as to how to get involved!

https://linktr.ee/ActiveMindsWestern

For more information on the international organization, please visit http://www.activeminds.org/index.php.
value.Summary: We are Western students with a mission to raise awareness and change the conversation about mental health. We want to build a community where students become better educated and feel comfortable understanding their own mental health.

value.Name: Black Students Association
value.Description: The Black Students’ Association is a USC student-run club at the University of Western Ontario. Since its inception in 1993, BSA has had a deep investment in the black student experience at Western. We have a firm commitment to keeping our members informed of political/social issues that affect people of colour within the UWO/London community and ultimately around the world. We seek to foster community ties and provide a safe space for students to socialize.
value.Summary: The Black Students’ Association is a USC student-run club at the University of Western Ontario. BSA has had a deep investment in the black student experience at Western. We seek to foster community ties and provide a safe space for students to socialize.

value.Name: Magic:  The Gathering Association
value.Description: The Magic: The Gathering Trading Card Game club at Western. We welcome both casual and competitive players. Weekly meetings with drafts, EDH, Modern, Standard, etc.
value.Summary: The Magic: The Gathering Trading Card Game club at Western. We welcome both casual and competitive players. Weekly meetings with drafts, tournaments etc.

value.Name: Hip Hop Western
value.Summary: Hip Hop Western is one of the premier hip hop dance clubs at the University of Western Ontario. We hold classes every week that ranges from beginner to advanced, as well as guest workshops from dancers from Toronto and other universities!

value.Name: Western Sports Analytics Club
value.Description: The Western Sports Analytics Club will host watch parties for major sporting events with food and drinks, fantasy sports leagues, risk-free sports picking tournaments, and educational opportunities via talks with professionals in the sports industry. All levels of experience with analytics are welcome, and any big sports fan would fit perfectly into the club. What are you waiting for? Sign up now!
value.Summary: The Western Sports Analytics Club will host watch parties for major sporting events with food and drinks, fantasy sports leagues, risk-free sports picking tournaments, and educational opportunities via talks with professionals in the sports industry.

value.Name: Paper Art Club
value.Description:
Discover your creative side with the Paper Art Club! As the sole origami group on campus, we welcome students from all programs and origami experience to our weekly meetings where we fold everything from jumping frogs to flapping air planes. All you need to bring is your enthusiasm, and we'll supply the paper :)

Beyond paper folding, we take part in campus-wide events through our Annual Valentine's Day Rose Sale, selling over 400 origami roses to support local London organizations. Looking for ways to contribute outside of campus? Our volunteer opportunities include biweekly sessions guiding kids to fold origami at the London Public Library with our team. Come join our community for a fold-tastic time with the Paper Art Club!
value.Summary: Paper Art Club is a crafts club dedicated to origami, the art of paper folding.

value.Name: Western Crypto
value.Description: Western Crypto welcomes all to explore the realms of blockchain and cryptocurrencies, regardless of prior experience. Through immersive workshops, educationals, and guest speakers, members will be able to learn about the intricacies of blockchain and cryptocurrencies, while dissecting market trends and strategies. This club serves as a collaborative platform where diverse disciplines converge, fostering connections and innovative projects.
value.Summary: Western Crypto welcomes all to explore the realms of blockchain and cryptocurrencies, regardless of prior experience. Through immersive workshops, educationals, and guest speakers, members will be able to learn about the intricacies of the blockchain.

value.Name: Thaqalayn Muslim Association
value.Description: The community of Shi'a Muslim students at Western University is one that has largely been missing a unifying voice to address their various needs, be it academic, social, or spiritual. The aim behind establishing the TMA is to create a support system and cater primarily, although not exclusively, to the needs of the Shi'a Muslim students on campus. The TMA focuses on leadership, integrity, and communication while simultaneously representing a collective voice and pursuing student ideals.
value.Summary: The TMA is a diverse group which focuses on leadership, integrity, and communication, whilst establishing a voice for Shi'a students on campus.

value.Name: Western Crafting for a Cure
value.Description: Western CFC strives to achieve the goals of the not-for-profit registered charity Crafting for a Cure by facilitating unique volunteer opportunities for students. Through arts and crafts, as well as other creative activities, volunteers will get the chance to interact with children in hospitals and health organizations around London. Western CFC allows students to engage themselves and the creative minds of kids while giving back to the greater London community. Volunteering will combine the creativity and caring nature of Western students with interacting with children to create an enjoyable and memorable time for both! Become a member today to join the fun and help make a difference!
value.Summary: Western CFC strives to achieve the goals of the not-for-profit registered charity "Crafting for a Cure" by facilitating unique volunteer opportunities for students.

value.Name: Western Country Club
value.Description: Howdy, welcome to the Western Country Club! Our mission is to foster a tight-knit community through events, concerts, and socials. Open to all students, our club offers a space where members can connect over their love for country music. Our mission for the Western Country Club is to bring students together and socialize over something we all have in common. We aim for our members to feel welcomed and to create opportunity for long lasting friendships with students throughout the university. Whether you listen to Morgan Wallen, Tim McGraw, or Zach Bryan, be sure to join us for a good ol' Western time. Yeehaw!
value.Summary: Howdy, welcome to the Western Country Club! Our mission is to foster a tight-knit community through events, concerts, and socials.

value.Name: Jordanian Cultural Club
value.Description: Cultivating Jordanian cultural connections at Western university. Explore the richness through engaging events and enlightening experiences.
value.Summary: Cultivating Jordanian cultural connections at Western university. Explore the richness through engaging events and enlightening experiences.

value.Name: Pre-Business Students' Network
value.Description: The Pre-Business Students Network (PBSN) is the largest general business club on campus. We are committed to enhancing the experience for students interested in business through workshops, competitions, mentorship, networking sessions, and much more. PBSN is the umbrella organization for all business areas; we host events relevant to Consulting, Finance, Accounting, Entrepreneurship and Business Information Technology. We welcome students from all faculties and backgrounds to join our network of like-minded students and alumni. Get involved with PBSN to build meaningful connections and gain hands-on experience!
value.Summary: The Pre-Business Students Network (PBSN) is Western's largest general business club committed to enhancing the experience for students interested in business through workshops, competitions, networking sessions, mentorship and much more.

value.Name: Fashion & Lifestyle Society
value.Description:
For those with an appreciation for contemporary and high fashion, welcome to Western’s only fashion community. The Fashion and Lifestyle Society (F&LS) is a truly eclectic mix of numerous styles housed under an umbrella of teams that allow members to express their creativity. We host fashion shows, socials and other various events throughout the year, not to mention furthering our own knowledge of fashion and the industry. As a member, you are given exclusive access to these functions.

Both of our runway shows address an expressive theme and are held every Fall and Spring season. F&LS also runs VOLTA, a bi-annual fashion and culture magazine that is produced by a team of 60+ students. Other divisions of F&LS include: communications team, events team, public relations, sponsorship, financial planning, modelling, styling, journalism, photography and multimedia production. Our main goal is to create and connect in style.
value.Summary: As Western's only Fashion Collective, F&LS aims to bring together Western's most fashionable and creative talent for a year of events, socials, and charitable activity. Not to mention furthering our own knowledge of fashion and the industry.
