value.Name: Western Accounting Association
value.Description:
The Western Accounting Association was created to meet the demands of students interested in the accounting profession. WAA provides students with the opportunity to explore the Chartered Professional Accountant designation and learn the requirements of either program. The club primarily acts as a liaison between professional firms, accounting bodies and students by offering information sessions, useful resources and tools that aid professional development and sending members to competitions such as the Chartered Professional Accountants Ontario's CPA Challenge and Chartered for Finance Conference.  WAA also sends multiple students to external case competitions, and hosts a number of in-house networking events to build relations between students and major accounting firms.

Sign-up for our mailing list here to receive updates on our events and more.

Visit us on our Social Media Sites!

WAA Website

LinkedIn Group

Facebook Page

Twitter Account

Instagram Account
value.Summary: Providing members with the experiences and preparation needed to thrive as the accounting professionals of tomorrow.

value.Name: Sociology Students Association
value.Summary: The SSA provides undergraduate sociology students with an opportunity to get involved in the sociology department by offering networking opportunities with professors and fellow sociology students and numerous social and academic events.

value.Name: Western Investment Club
value.Description:
Our History

The Western Investment Club (WIC) is one of the largest clubs on Western University’s campus, with membership currently over 800 students. The club was first established back in 1985 by a small group of young investors and has since grown to have an alumni presence all around the globe.


The club’s primary mandate is to educate all students at Western on the skills needed to become a value investor. WIC achieves this by giving weekly educational presentations, reports on industry news and by managing a portfolio of equities with real capital. WIC manages a $300,000 diversified fund of U.S and Canadian equities and applies a value investing philosophy. The portfolio is segmented into six different industry sectors led by a team of analysts. All buy and sell pitches for the fund are put forward at general meetings by the analyst team with the support of researchers and general members.

Getting Involved

Students from all faculties are encouraged to join as general members, regardless of skill level. General meetings and all researcher meetings take place on a weekly basis. Membership to the Western Investment Club gives you access to the following:

  • Weekly general meetings, where all educationals, news events, and pitches are presented,
  • Superday workshops, where the most important valuation and finance skills are concisely taught,
  • Social and networking events, where you can meet with internal members and WIC alumni,
  • Researcher eligibility, which allows you to follow an industry and assist with presentations,
  • A network of thousands of Ivey and Western alumni,
  • Exclusive job postings into the finance world,
  • A growing community of like-minded and ambitious individuals.
value.Summary: The Western Investment Club ("WIC")'s mandate is to spark interest in young investors, and teach the fundamentals of value investing. The club manages over $300,000 of real capital in a diversified portfolio of U.S. and Canadian equities.

value.Name: African Students Association
value.Description:
The African Students’ Association (ASA) is a cultural club that celebrates and raises awareness of African culture at Western University and around the City of London. We also engage our members in socio-political forums that provide a platform to discuss issues Africans face in Canada and abroad.

Another central part of our mission is to provide a home away from home for African students new to Canada, and to support them during their enculturation at Western. At the same time, we strive to hold social events that appeal to people of all races and ethnicities that have an interest or curiosity about Africa the land, the people that inhabit her, and/or the current events occurring there. 

Moreover, as part of our strategy, we focus on fund-raising for local charities that promote the welfare and advancement of needy and vulnerable peoples in Africa.

Our vision is to create a better awareness, understanding and appreciation of Africa culture, to break down social barriers between Africans and non-Africans.
value.Summary: Celebrating and raising awareness of African culture at Western University and around London. Anyone is welcome to join our club.

value.Name: Health Occupation Students of America Western
value.Description: HOSA Western’s mission is to give individuals who have a passion for health science a place to connect with like-minded people and develop their passion by providing them with an environment that tests their skills in healthcare. HOSA Western aims to help students become more open to different careers related to health sciences. There are hundreds of possibilities for a career in healthcare or medicine, yet sadly many of these options are not even considered by students. HOSA Western hopes to create a safe place for all science students to engage their interests. The club will hold weekly workshops where club members will be guided through various healthcare-related skills and topics by students who are not professionals but have previous experience with the HOSA competition. They have experience preparing for the Spring Leadership Conference (National Competition) and the International Leadership Conference (International Competition).
value.Summary: HOSA Western’s mission is to give individuals who have a passion for health science a place to connect with like-minded people and develop their passion by providing them with an environment that tests their skills in healthcare.

value.Name: Western 3D Printing Club
value.Description: 3D Western introduces students to 3D printing and advanced additive manufacturing through workshops and competitions. We welcome beginner and experienced makers alike! Our club develops innovating new methods of 3D Printing alongside simplifying CAD (computer-aided design), slicing, and 3D printing for inexperienced students to understand and develop their skills for medicine, engineering, art, and beyond.
value.Summary: 3D Western introduces students to 3D-printing and Computer Aided Design (CAD) through events that allow students to explore this technology in both theory and with hands on experience.

value.Name: The Butterfly Effect UWO
value.Description: This initiative introduces hundreds of students to the world of paying it forward and performing random acts of kindness, which can have significant impacts on the performer, the recipient and even the observer of the act of kindness. We plan to run monthly kindness events in hopes of creating a more welcoming and kind environment, both at Western and in the London community.
value.Summary: This initiative introduces hundreds of students to the world of paying it forward and performing random acts of kindness, which can have significant impacts on the performer, the recipient and even the observer of the act of kindness

value.Name: Chinese Students Association
value.Description:
Western’s Chinese Students' Association (CSA) is one of the oldest and largest social clubs on campus. Since 1960, we've been planning social events to foster a safe, fun, and inclusive community for everyone. Our membership brings students from all walks of life to our events to make new friends, play games, take a break from studying, and even meet celebrities at our flagship singing competition, Western Voice.

Your membership purchase includes our branded merchandise (one printed cotton tote, one printed cotton t-shirt, one printed shotglass, and one round sticker) + one Western Foodies discount card. This card, in partnership with Western Foodies, gives you access to their wealth of discounts on local eats!
value.Summary: The Chinese Students' Association of the University of Western Ontario is one of the oldest and largest of the Chinese cultural clubs. We focus primarily on creating social events, such as our signature cooperative events: Western Voice singing...

value.Name: Ukrainian Students Club
value.Description: The Western Ukrainian Students Association is a great opportunity to get in touch with Ukrainian culture! Our goal is to foster a sense of community on campus through various social, cultural and educational events. The club welcomes all students with an interest in learning about Ukrainian culture!
value.Summary: Meet Ukrainian students that attend Western University and be a part of London's vibrant Ukrainian community! Get in touch with your heritage and learn about Ukrainian culture!

value.Name: Anthropology Society
value.Description: The Western Anthropology Society is an undergraduate society ratified by the University Student Council, dedicated to the enhancement of Anthropological knowledge through academic and social endeavours in order to improve the undergraduate university experience at Western University for its members as well as the rest of the community. The aim of the Anthropology Society is to achieve these goals through both formal and informal events designed to promote and stimulate students into taking a more active role within the discipline of Anthropology, the department, the University, the community and with peers.
value.Summary: The Anthropology Society is a great way to meet people in the department, get info and help with anything Anthropology related. The club also has fun social events.

value.Name: The Comedy Club
value.Description:
We're the funniest group on campus! We do any and all things funny, improv, sketches, stand up, goofs, you name it! We've had a dedicated group of comedians for years now, and hold weekly improv meetings. 

Improv Club:

We do improv at weekly meetings, both Canadian Improv Games-style and Whose Line Is It Anyways-style. If you did improv at high school, or if you're interested in learning good performance skills then come on down! No previous experience required. We've been asked to do workshops for business clubs on improv skills too! It's a great way to work on staying cool under pressure. We also do shows! 

Write Club:

This is where the written word gets awesome. Here we write sketches, videos, stand-up and anything else. It's a smaller, laid back and packed with hillarity. Looking to workshop a short play you've written? Punch up a sketch? Make a hillarious YouTube video? WE DO IT ALL. It's a great place to practice creative writing and collaborative stuff. The best part? We have a huge show where we put it all on!

The Improv Team:

This is a dedicated group of students who represent Western in competitions around Southern Ontario and Quebec against other schools (Such as McGill, Brock and UofT). We hold try-outs in October, and have a final team of 8-10 people. We do plenty of training sessions beforehand though, and have taken on people who did improv at high school and people who just started. Come on out!

COMEDY@CAMPUS:

We will work together this year to give you quality workshops that are engaging and will improve your skills Follow our instagram for more information @westerncomedyclub  !
value.Summary: Western's number one spot for comedy since our ratification in 2005 and near de-ratification 2005 to now! We have a weekly Improv meeting, where we learn skills and perform, as well as Write Club, where we write and perform sketches and stand-up comedy!

value.Name: Canadian Feed the Children
value.Description: Western Canadian Feed The Children (CFTC) is a charity club devoted to advocating for food security and health in the local London community. We are a charter of Canadian Feed the Children, which is a Canadian-recognized charity that aims to promote a more equitable and sustainable future for all children. Our club events take a community-based and personalized approach. We are always looking to partner up with local London actors to fulfill shared objectives.
value.Summary: Western Canadian Feed The Children (CFTC) is a charity club devoted to advocating for food security and health in the local London community.

value.Name: Western Ski & Snowboard Club
value.Description: The objective of the Western Ski & Snowboard Club is to provide exciting and unique opportunities for students to enjoy the sport of skiing and snowboarding through community building. We focus on organizing trips throughout the school year to various resorts and locations, including students of all experience levels and backgrounds. Our primary vision is to create a sense of connection amongst members and to impart students with memories of skiing and snowboarding in their university experience. Western Ski & Snowboard Club will host various social events throughout the school year and ski trips during the winter season that are tailored to all interested students, regardless of skill level. Our mission for the Western Ski & Snowboard Club is to bring students together and bond over something we all call home. We want our members to feel welcomed and to create lasting friendships with those who share the same love of skiing and snowboarding. The Western Ski & Snowboard Club gives the opportunity for every undergraduate student a chance to enjoy the winters sports they love.
value.Summary: The objective of the Western Ski & Snowboard Club is to provide exciting and unique opportunities for students to enjoy the sport of skiing and snowboarding, while making the sport more accessible.

value.Name: Tea Club
value.Description: As we all know, university life can be very stressful. Tea Club is the de-stressor club of Western! Tea Club aims to provide a cozy atmosphere, where students can relax as they grab a cup of tea. We host information sessions, where members can learn about how to brew a perfect cup of tea, different varieties of tea, and more! By the end of the year, we hope our members will not only have created lasting friendships, but have also garnered a greater appreciation for tea. Typically, we hold frequent events during the year, creating opportunities for students to socialize (tea party, field trips, guest speakers, game/movie nights, study sessions, etc.) It's super chill and full of great people, so join us for some quali-tea time! :)
value.Summary: Tea Club aims to provide a cozy atmosphere, where students can relax as they grab a cup of tea. Tea Club members will have opportunities to meet new people, while they gain a lot of interesting knowledge in tea.

value.Name: Palestinian Cultural Club
value.Description: The Palestinian Cultural Club is a student club created with the goal of celebrating the beauty that is Palestine. Palestine is in the media often but rarely showcasing the aesthetic, the richness of its history or even the significant and prestigious religious presence. Although the politics is very relevant, we want to showcase the heritage & culture of Palestine. Being that most are unable to visit, this is our effort to provide all of our members a home away from home. Our club is, of course, open to every single person that has a curiosity and love for Palestine and its culture... we welcome everyone.
value.Summary: The Palestinian Cultural Club is a student club created with the goal of celebrating the beauty that is Palestine & its extensive culture.

value.Name: Western Trivia Club
value.Description: Western Trivia Club is all about playing various forms of trivia and fostering a collaborative space for those who enjoy fun facts and friendly competition. We meet every Monday and Thursday from 6-8 pm in Social Science 3014 to play Quizbowl, Reach for the Top/Consensus, Jeopardy, and variety of other trivia games. If you are interested we welcome you all to join us! Check out our Instagram and join our club's Discord in the link in our IG bio!
value.Summary: Western Trivia Club is all about playing various forms of trivia. Quizbowl tournaments are our main challenge, but we enjoy trivia in many forms and on many topics. All are welcome, regardless of expertise or experience.

value.Name: motionballU Western
value.Description: motionballU Western is a club dedicated to organizing integrated sporting and social programs with Special Olympic athletes and Western University students. As a chapter of the larger motionball organization, our events aim to promote the inclusion and well-being of individuals with intellectual disabilities by introducing these athletes to Western students in a fun and supportive environment. We believe that the next generation of Canadians, today’s students and young professionals, are the future of the Special Olympics movement – with the power to raise awareness and make a meaningful difference for generations to come.
value.Summary: motionballU Western is a club dedicated to organizing integrated sporting and social programs with Special Olympic athletes and Western University students.

value.Name: Model United Nations Society
value.Description:
Welcome to Western Model United Nations! We are so excited to have you here. 

Since our inception in 1997, we have served as one of the longest-standing clubs here on Western campus; we can't wait to have you join us. While we are called Western MUN, our focus stretches beyond that of simply participating and organizing Model UN conferences. We seek to involve our membership in opportunities that allow them to apply the knowledge they know about the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals to real-life situations, such as participating in food drives or other charitable events. 

Through discourse and debate, we hope to introduce more students to the UNSDGs, and for our returning members, we hope these events will help improve public speaking and research skills that can be applied in other disciplines. We will be partnering with other political science clubs such as AIR, PSA, Liberals, and Young Conservatives to host future events, and we strongly encourage you to like us on Facebook and follow us on Instagram to recieve notifications about these events. 

This year, as a result of COVID-19, we will be hosting a one-day internal conference through Gatherly during the fall semester to better prepare us for the winter semester, more info to come. During the winter semester, we are tentatively planning to send delegations to McMUN and HMUN, with more info to come as to whether the events will take place in person or online, in accordance with USC policy. 

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to shoot us an email at uwomun@gmail.com.
value.Summary:
We facilitate discourse through hosting debates, workshops, and conferences in the spirit of the United Nations. 
Facebook: UWOMUN, Instagram: UWOMUN 
Follow us on social media for info on how to join our discord server and fb member's group!

value.Name: Faculty of Information & Media Studies Students' Council
value.Description: The Faculty of Information and Media Studies Students’ Council (FIMSSC) is a student-run organization at Western University that endeavors to enhance the undergraduate student experience in FIMS by providing various opportunities by which students can become involved in the faculty. Through FIMSSC, students can get involved in a number of different ways: volunteering for the Street Team, Charity Committee, or the mitZine; attending and planning faculty events; supporting fellow student initiatives; addressing and voting on faculty-related issues at town meetings, round-tables, and departmental general assemblies. We also work to connect students with opportunities both within the faculty and externally in the Western and London community. FIMSSC represents all students in FIMS and, as such, lobbies to the Faculty on behalf of student interests in order to ensure the needs of all FIMS students are adequately met.
value.Summary: The Undergraduate Students' Council of the Faculty of Information & Media Studies.

value.Name: Pre-Optometry Club
value.Description: Our club aims to give students the resources necessary to become involved in optometry. By hosting information sessions from optometry schools across North America, providing study tips for the OAT, organizing a dinner with current optometry students and many more events, this club will provide the opportunity for students to learn more about the field of optometry.
value.Summary: The Pre-Optometry Club strives to provide students with resources that will help them become involved in the field of optometry.

value.Name: Western Real Estate Club
value.Description: The Western Estate Club (WREC) is the only real estate club at Western University which is accessible to all Western University students. Our goal is to educate students from the Western community on the various domains of the real estate industry through case competitions, networking events, guest speakers, and more.
value.Summary: The Western Estate Club (WREC) is the only real estate club at Western University which is accessible to all Western University students. We educate students by inviting professionals from across the industry to speak to our club about their careers.

value.Name: Esports & Gaming Association
value.Description:
The Western Esports & Gaming Association is a community for students on campus who enjoy playing video games, and who like to meet and socialize with other gamers. WEGA runs a wide variety of events throughout the year – tournaments and other competitions for those who love to compete, more casual gaming nights to make connections and enjoy games together, as well as more casual social events to build a community.

WEGA also helps to run a number of esports teams across a wide variety of titles. If you’re interested in playing your game at the highest level, we’d love to help connect you with other students looking to do the same.

Join our community! (discord.gg/WEGA)
value.Summary: The Western Esports & Gaming Association (WEGA) is a platform for Western students with a love for gaming to socialize and play. With LANs and weekly console meetups, the club aims to bring together like-minded gamers and build a community.

value.Name: Alzheimer's Western Club
value.Description: At the Alzheimer's Western Club, our core mission is to educate and spread awareness to the London community and students at Western about Alzheimer's disease and related dementias. By doing so, we aim to reduce the disease's stigma and change the general public's possible preconceptions. Our qualified team of executives, directors and members support the Alzheimer Society of London and Middlesex through fundraising activities and events so that the proper care and resources are available to the individuals and families affected by Alzheimer's disease and other dementias.
value.Summary: A student-run philanthropic group that aims to spread awareness about Alzheimer's disease and related dementias in the community and in the Western & affiliate student body, as well as support the local Alzheimer Society.

value.Name: ACE Western (formerly DECA Western)
value.Description: Western University's ACE chapter is part of an international organization striving to help motivated students become future business industry leaders. At ACE Western, we have three key pillars: professional development, competitive excellence, and network expansion. At ACE Western, students engage with business-related areas such as business law, consulting, entrepreneurship, finance, management, marketing, and sales in educational and competitive settings. A membership with ACE Western allows you to participate in all of our conferences, business case competitions, and workshops, as well as have the opportunity to apply to join our executive leadership team. In addition, we compete annually at the ACE Nationals in downtown Toronto, Canada's largest undergraduate business case competition. Whether you have been involved with ACE since high school or this is your first time, you are welcome to join us.
value.Summary: Western University's ACE chapter is part of an international organization striving to help motivated students become future business industry leaders.

value.Name: Seniors in IT
value.Description:
Seniors in I.T. is a dynamic student-run volunteer organization. We strive to provide senior citizens with the knowledge and skills to operate in this new technology-based world. Seniors in I.T. aims to provide seniors with a fundamental understanding of technology so that they are able to achieve a variety of personal aspirations such as:

  •  Reconnect with family and friends via e-mail or other programs such as skype
  • Draft letters using a word processor
  • Broaden their knowledge using search engines, image searches, video repositories etc.
  • Utilize a digital camera to share pictures with family and friends.

We strive to give our volunteers a fulfilling and enriching inter-generational learning opportunity. In doing so, our volunteers develop their leadership, communication and interpersonal skills.

We were recently profiled in the London Free Press, check out the article at the link below:

http://www.lfpress.com/2012/11/23/its-the-only-club-at-the-school-that-partners-with-retired-londoners
value.Summary: The objective of Seniors in I.T. is to equip senior citizens with the knowledge and skills to operate in this new, technology-based world while involving students in an intergenerational learning opportunity. Seniors in I.T. aims to provide seniors w…

value.Name: Penned by Western (formerly Spoken Word Society)
value.Description:
For too long, students at Western University have been unable to find a creative writing club. That's why the Spoken Word Society was founded in 2019 to be a place for students to bond over the power of creation and language. In 2021, we decided to change the club name to Penned by Western to better reflect the varied interests of our members and the many types of creative writing out there. We want all writers to feel welcome and to find a space here. We're excited to create, share, and discover writing penned by Western students!

We host weekly workshops, designed not only to help you learn more about the craft of writing but also to start writing and receive feedback! Evenings usually feature a short presentation and a few writing prompts. Then we give you time to write with the opportunity to share your work at the end.​

So far, we have also hosted several online poetry open mic nights. While Zoom may be a limitation, it has also allowed us to connect with students from other universities across the country for the performing and sharing of poetry. The relaxed and encouraging atmosphere of these nights is nothing short of magic, so keep an eye out for our next one to join in.

Spoken word lends itself to sharing, so we won't forget our roots but we're excited to welcome all members of Western's creative community!
value.Summary:
Penned by Western is Western University's only creative writing club. We run weekly writing workshops and occasional open mic nights and poetry slams. Our goal is to develop and encourage Western's creative community! 

Instagram: @pennedbywestern

value.Name: Dumbledore's Army
value.Description:
Dumbledore's Army is all about celebrating a common passion for the Harry Potter movies and book series through fun social events. Throughout the year memories will be made, and saved in the pensieve for later, through events such as: a sorting ceremony, Yule Ball, on-going House Cup, movie marathons, snitch and Horcrux hunts, and much more! We welcome everyone, from fully fledged Potterheads to those who just want more exposure to Harry Potter and want to make new friends!

Please join our Facebook group for the year: "Dumbledore's Army UWO 2023-2024" and sign up for your membership here: https://www.westernusc.store
value.Summary: Dumbledore's Army is an interactive and exciting club that unites students through social events designed to create friendships and celebrate a common passion for Harry Potter.

value.Name: Trek for Teens
value.Description: Trek for Teens Western envisions a campus that is educated and aware of youth homelessness and will unite together to combat this problem. Through a wide variety of fun events and campaigns, we strive to destigmatize, encourage conversation on, and contribute to solving the issue of youth homelessness in London, Ontario. It is our intent to provide a means for everyone to enjoy making a difference through their own talents and skills.
value.Summary: Trek for Teens strives to destigmatize, encourage conversation on, and contribute to solving the issue of youth homelessness.

value.Name: Western Chess & Go Club
value.Summary: The Chess Club provides a fun atmosphere to play chess! Whether you are looking to learn the game for the first time, looking to better your skills, or simply looking to find and take on the competition, the chess club has it all!

value.Name: Students for Health Humanities
value.Description: Students for Health Humanities at Western University is a welcoming club that promotes empathy and compassion in the health field through interdisciplinary discussions, projects, and volunteerism. We explore topics like narrative medicine, perceptions of illness and recovery, and medical representation in art. By fostering a holistic outlook, we aim to challenge the traditional impersonal approach to healthcare and cultivate a more compassionate future. Join us in shaping a healthcare landscape that values human connection and individual experiences.
value.Summary: Students for Health Humanities at Western University is a welcoming club that promotes empathy and compassion in the health field through interdisciplinary discussions, projects, and volunteerism.

value.Name: Western Youth Connect (formerly known as Save the Children)
value.Description: Western Youth Connect is dedicated to protecting and promoting awareness on children's rights, not only in developing countries, but in Canada as well. Our vision is to create effective changes that positively affect children worldwide now and in future generations through education and the involvement of communities. Participate and become active in a mission that will give children a healthy, happy and safe childhood. You can help us to deliver immediate and lasting improvements to children's lives worldwide. As a member you can make a difference!
value.Summary: Western Youth Connect is dedicated to protecting and promoting awareness on children's rights, not only in developing countries, but in Canada as well.  Our clubs provides you with the opportunity to volunteer right here in London.

value.Name: Western Christian Students
value.Description:
The goal of this club is to create a friendly, welcoming community for students to partake in fellowship and create connections with fellow believers.  We primarily focus on reading the Bible together and sharing our thoughts, but also partake in fun socials when we can! This club is open to those who are already believers, as well as those who may not call themselves believers yet but are interested in learning more about Christ!

Find all our links here!

https://lnk.bio/westernu.christians
value.Summary: The goal of this club is to create a friendly, welcoming community for students to partake in fellowship and create connections with fellow believers.

value.Name: Western Marketing Association
value.Description: Western Marketing Association (WMA) is dedicated to engaging, empowering, and impacting Western students interested in marketing. WMA provides events, conferences, mentorship, and internship opportunities to its members, focusing on skill development, networking, and exposure to the marketing industry. Through WMA, students are able to learn and experience the marketing world and both apply and reevaluate their knowledge of marketing strategy. Although WMA has a focus on marketing, the club provides experience in nearly all sectors of business where marketing touches upon, making it one of the most diverse and comprehensive business clubs at Western.
value.Summary: Western Marketing Association (WMA) aims to engage, empower, and impact students interested in marketing. Through internships, conferences, and career-building networking, WMA offers opportunities to get involved and learn about the future of marketing.

value.Name: Association of International Relations
value.Description: The Association of International Relations (AIR) aims to create an environment where international diplomacy, State-relations, and world issues can be openly discussed and analyzed by Western students interested in the areas of politics and history. Our club will provide students who wish to understand and debate such topics a forum in which to do so. Our club will give students the opportunity to learn about such topics and develop their own opinions and views of the issues at hand. This club will provide a diverse range of interpretations regarding both current and historical events associated with international relations in order to foster an environment of critical and independent thinking. We wish to provide Western students the opportunity to discuss emerging events in global politics and the responses to them. We hope to promote a greater understanding of international affairs and global development through a process of exploration and debate. We wish to create a community in which students can express their views on these topics and brainstorm potential solutions to pressing world issues; a community where students can  learn and engage with other group members who are also interested in international relations. This club will encourage the progress and betterment of both our members and our community, and the global community at large. The Association of International Relations seeks to establish a forum in which the views of Western students can create a sustainable and profound impact on the international structure. We hope to bring awareness to the university about important world issues and to cooperate and keep in contact with other clubs and students on campus interested in such topics.
value.Summary: The Association of International Relations (AIR) aims to create an environment where international diplomacy, state-relations, and world issues can be openly discussed and analyzed by Western students interested in the areas of politics and history.

value.Name: Purple Yogis
value.Description:
The Purple Yogis is an affordable way for Western Students to enhance and maintain their health throughout the school year. The Purple Yogis provide a community for beginner yogis to teachers alike to connect with one another through the practice of yoga. No yoga experience is needed! The yoga classes offer a focus on improving the physical, spiritual, and mental health of members. 

Members can expect an inclusive Western Experience that students of different backgrounds, languages and cultures can join in a positive way. Yoga classes will be offered both in person and online and taught by qualified yoga teachers from the London community. Interactive events will be held throughout the year on campus and through our social media platforms.

For more information, follow us on Facebook (@uwopurpleyogis) or Instagram (@purple_yogis), or email us at purpleyogis.club@westerusc.ca.
value.Summary: Offering Western students an affordable way to increase and maintain health throughout a potentially stressful school year.

value.Name: Chinese Christian Club
value.Description: A Christian fellowship for Mandarin and Cantonese speaking students at the University of Western Ontario. We work closely with the Outreach Department of the Chinese Fellowship at West London Alliance Church. Our mission is to encourage witness to our Lord Jesus Christ to spread out the gospel on-campus to lead people to a personal faith in Jesus Christ.
value.Summary: A Christian fellowship for Mandarin and Cantonese speaking students at Western. We work closely with the Outreach Department of the Chinese Fellowship at West London Alliance Church. Our mission is to encourage witness to our Lord Jesus Christ.

value.Name: Faculty of Law
value.Summary: Tba

value.Name: Heart & Stroke Western
value.Description: The Heart and Stroke Club is an organization that brings the values, beliefs and guidance of the Heart and Stroke Foundation into University life. Working alongside the London Branch of the Heart and Stroke Foundation, the club is designed to raise awareness for various cardiovascular threats, promote/provide a healthier lifestyle and to fundraise actively to help facilitate the research being conducted by the Heart and Stroke Foundation. The club achieves its mandate through several events, some directly organized by the foundation and others unique to the club. The Heart and Stroke club has many volunteer and leadership opportunities to offer.
value.Summary: The Heart and Stroke Club is an organization that brings the values, beliefs and guidance of the Heart and Stroke Foundation into University life. Working alongside the London Branch of Heart and Stroke Foundation, the club is designed to raise aware…

value.Name: ALS Western
value.Description: ALS Western serves to bring the fight against ALS to Western students. Our goals are to raise awareness and increase knowledge of ALS, build community support for those with ALS and provide unique and fulfilling, charitable opportunities for students. Through frequent posts on social media, providing different volunteer opportunities, hosting educational seminars along with running community events, ALS Western will take different avenues to achieve our goals. We seek to create a community among students that is well informed about ALS and helps members of the community who are affected by it. We strive to enrich the student experience by providing the personally fulfilling and satisfying experience of helping others in need while becoming personally more knowledgeable on this condition.
value.Summary: ALS Western serves to bring the fight against ALS to Western students

value.Name: Beauty and Lifestyle Inspiring Student Self-Esteem
value.Description: BLISS is a gender-inclusive club that opens its arms to all walks of life. Our club focuses on using beauty and facets of our lifestyle to foster/grow self-esteem. With a previous focus on makeup, this year we intend to expand to skin and personal care. We aim to eradicate stigmas, such as sexism and stereotypes, to create a safe and inclusive space for our members.
value.Summary: BLISS is a gender-inclusive club that opens its arms to all walks of life. Our club focuses on using beauty and facets of our lifestyle to foster/grow self-esteem. This year we intend to focus on skincare, makeup, and personal care.

value.Name: Computer Science Undergraduate Society
value.Description: The Computer Science Undergraduate Society (CSUS) is the oldest and most established computer science student organization on campus. We organize educational events, professional development workshops to help you land that next internship, and social events to get to know students just like yourself! Whether you’re a CS major or just interested in the subject, we encourage you to become a CSUS member and join Western's growing computer science community!
value.Summary: Whether you’re a CS major or just interested in the subject, we encourage you to become a CSUS member and join Western's growing computer science community!

value.Name: African Student Fellowship
value.Description: We aim to foster a vibrant community of students who are passionate about their Christian faith and their heritage. We are dedicated to creating a welcoming space where students can deepen their relationship with God, celebrate the African diaspora, and cultivate friendships. Through prayer and worship we aim to empower our members to grow spiritually, academically, and personally. Together, we seek to make a positive impact on our campus and beyond, sharing the love of Christ and the richness of African traditions with all.
value.Summary: African Student Fellowship is student run Christian based club that aims to connect students with their Christian faith and African culture through praise, worship and prayer.

value.Name: Pre-Law Society
value.Description:
The Western Pre-Law Society is an academic club for those who are interested in pursuing a career in the field of Law. The club provides speakers and events geared towards helping our members gain entrance into the law school of their choice and those interested in the field. 

2023-2024 Executive:

President: Annie Chen & Grace Gallant

VP Events: Michael Rendon

VP Finance: Kathleena Henricus & Nathan Yee

VP Communications: Mara Armitage
value.Summary: The Pre-Law Society is an academic club for those who are interested in pursuing a career in the field of Law. The club provides speakers and events geared towards helping our members gain entrance into the law school of their choice.

value.Name: Japanese Student Association
value.Description:
What you need to know about JSA:

★ Yokoso! We welcome anyone attending Western - faculty, undergraduates, graduates, and international students to join!

☆ Connect with Japanese exchange & international students, and other Western students interested in Japanese culture, language & style!

★ Japanese International Students: We want to make sure that you receive the right support, and enjoy your student experience at Western!

☆ Learn more about Japanese culture

★ Conversation groups to sharpen your Japanese/English skills in a friendly non-classroom environment!

☆ Events with Japanese style and tons of prizes up for grabs!
value.Summary: Welcome to the Japanese Student Association (JSA). We are a cultural and language exchange club open to everyone!

value.Name: Theatre Western
value.Description:
Western’s foremost theatre provider💜

Theatre Western is a vibrant and passionate community dedicated to the captivating world of the performing arts. Within our club, you will find a diverse ensemble of creative individuals who share a love for the stage and the magic it holds. Through script readings, performances, and shared experiences, we foster collaboration and artistic development. At our core, we are a close-knit family, bound by our unwavering passion for the theatre and our commitment to achieving excellence.

Join us for our annual Purple Shorts short play festival, Fall Play, Project Sparkles queer cabaret, Spring Musical, and Dubbies award night.
value.Summary: Western’s foremost theatre provider💜

value.Name: Power to Change - Western
value.Description: We are dedicated to helping students discover Jesus and change the world. We want students to experience God’s love and forgiveness and become world changers as they make faith a lifelong commitment. Power to Change - Students is also a chapter of Power to Change Ministries, an international interdenominational Christian ministry committed to helping take the Gospel of Jesus Christ to all nations. It is the largest not-for-profit organization in the world, reaching over 191 nations.
value.Summary: We are a movement dedicated to helping students discover Jesus and change the world. We want students to experience God’s love and forgiveness and become world changers as they make faith a lifelong commitment.

value.Name: Chamber Music
value.Description: Western Chamber Music (WCM) was established for those who are passionate about music or hoping to develop a new talent/hobby. We welcome and provide a comfortable environment for students at all skill levels. WCM provides an opportunity for people to connect with other musicians and participate in music ensembles and performance events on and off campus. In the past, we have held many successful concerts and charitable events in our community, and we look forward to continuing this tradition and expanding it across UWO's community of passionate musicians.
value.Summary: Western Chamber Music (WCM) was established for those who are passionate about music or hoping to develop a new talent/hobby. We welcome and provide a comfortable environment for students at all skill levels. WCM provides an opportunity for people t…

value.Name: Space Society of London
value.Description: The Space Society of London (SSoL) is a Western Club for anyone who has an interest in space. If you like to learn about our universe, want to be an astronaut one day, enjoy space sci-fi or just enjoy looking at the stars this club is for you. This club is meant for space lovers of all levels and backgrounds so please don't be discouraged to join even if you don't know a lot about space. Join us for our many stargazing nights, guest speakers, movie nights, rocket launches and many other fun activities. We hope to see you at our events this year as a member of the Space Society of London!
value.Summary: This is a club for anyone who has an interest in space.  If you would like to learn about our universe, want to be an astronaut one day, or enjoy space sci-fi, then join us for our many guest speakers, observing nights, and other fun activities!

value.Name: Western Diabetes Association
value.Description: The objective of our club is to provide a medium for those interested or directly exposed to type 1 and type 2 diabetes at the University of Western Ontario. The Western Diabetes Association will work alongside the Canadian Diabetes Association, Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation and other organizations in order to promote research, raise awareness, as well as provide education to its members and the entire student body. Furthermore, one of the most crucial aspect of the club is philanthropy. WDA will host many events in order to raise funds and work towards improving the lives of those living with both type 1 and type 2 diabetes.
value.Summary: We aim to provide a medium for those interested or directly exposed to type 1 and type 2 diabetes at the University of Western Ontario. Our mission is to promote research, raise awareness, and provide education to our members and the school community.

value.Name: Association of Role Players
value.Description:
The Western Association of Role Players is a vibrant community with a goal of encouraging the enjoyment of tabletop role-playing games (TTRPGs). 

 

We have a wide variety of events to help folks find games to join, to learn more about TTRPGs, and to foster community. Our year starts with Introcon, which is free for everyone to attend. Gamekeepers will pitch their games, and you get to chat with them and pick a game you'd like to join. Or you can be the one to pitch your game and gather players!

 

After that, we host a number of one-shot conventions, where we gather to play themed one-shots that our members have put together. These will run on the last Saturdays of October, January, and March.

 

On the last Saturday of November, we participate in a multi-university charity program known as Dungeons, Dragons, and Donations (D3). Drop a donation to play in or run games for this 12-hour gamefest!

 

In December, we're holding a chill hangout night to watch movies, play board games, paint, and vibe. And in February, we're hosting a marketplace for all our creatives to sell their work, workshops, or commissions!

 

And let's not forget the WARPshops! Join us every other week for an evening workshop where we discuss various aspects of TTRPGs to improve our storytelling skills. 

 

So join us! Whether you're a DND veteran or completely new to the hobby, we're the perfect club to get you going. We look forward to rolling some dice with you this year, gamers!
value.Summary: We are your link to the table-top role playing game community at Western. All experience levels wanted, and all game systems encouraged!

value.Name: Western Mooting Society
value.Description: Western Mooting Society is an academic club that focuses on developing oral advocacy skills by participating in moot court (appeal court) style competitions. The Western Mooting Society will provide opportunities to network with those already in and those who graduated law school through such competition. The club focuses on the practical aspect of law in law school by attending mock competitions.
value.Summary: Western Mooting Society is an academic club that focuses on developing oral advocacy skills by participating in moot court (appeal court) style competitions.

value.Name: Chinese Cultural Games Club
value.Description:
The Chinese Cultural Games Club is dedicated in promoting the Chinese culture through various social and entertainment activities, spreading the understanding and awareness across the Western University and the London community.

As a club, we host regular weekly gatherings where we try to create a comfortable environment for our members to relax, interact, and make friends. Besides these, we also have large events such as the Chinese Cultural Cosplay Show and the Three Kingdom Contest every month, which brings in a lot of attention city wide.
value.Summary: The Chinese Cultural Games Club is dedicated in promoting the Chinese culture through various social and entertainment activities, spreading the understanding and awareness across the Western University and the London community.

value.Name: Right to Play Western
value.Description:
Looking to join the largest and best charity club on campus?
Use this link to join Right to Play Western and support children facing adversity in 20 countries across the world! 

https://www.westernusc.store

There are various leadership and volunteer opportunities, club socials, sports tournaments, and other fundraisers/events to get involved in! 

Right To Play is an international humanitarian organization that uses sport and play programs to improve health, develop life skills, and foster peace for children and communities in some of the most disadvantaged areas of the world. 

email: righttoplay.club@westernusc.ca

IG: RTPWestern

FB: https://www.facebook.com/rtpwestern/
value.Summary: Right To Play is an international humanitarian organization that uses sport and play programs to improve health, develop life skills, and foster peace for children and communities in some of the most disadvantaged areas of the world.

value.Name: Nursing Students' Association
value.Summary: Western Fanshawe Nursing Students' Association (WFNSA)

value.Name: Western Women in Leadership
value.Description:
Western Women In Leadership (WWIL) aims to empower young women at the University of Western Ontario towards embracing leadership roles and pursuing success. This community brings like-minded students and leaders together in a number of interactive workshops, intimate networking events, seminars, socials, fundraisers and conferences.

Follow us on Instagram (@wwomeninleadership) or on Facebook for the latest updates!
value.Summary: WWIL is a new club that desires to motivate young women at the University of Western Ontario toward embracing leadership roles and pursuing success.

value.Name: Western Schizophrenia Club
value.Description: Western Schizophrenia Club exists to raise awareness about schizophrenia and bring people together to enhance individuals’ passion regarding this severe disorder. The Western’s Schizophrenia Club will hold various social events informing people about the implications of schizophrenia as well as build a safe, enjoyable, and welcoming community!
value.Summary: Western Schizophrenia Club exists to raise awareness about schizophrenia and bring people together to enhance individuals’ passion regarding this severe disorder.

value.Name: Kidney Club of Western
value.Description: Dedicated to raising awareness and funding for kidney disease and kidney related research. We strive to educate university students about the implications of kidney disease and to create a supportive and inclusive community. Make sure to like our page on Facebook to keep updated about the events we will have throughout the school year!
value.Summary: Dedicated to raising awareness and funding for kidney disease and kidney related research. We strive to educate university students about the implications of kidney disease and to create a supportive and inclusive community.

value.Name: Vietnamese Students Association
value.Description: The Vietnamese Students’ Association is an organization dedicated to promoting Vietnamese culture, fostering social networks, and strengthening the bonds between Western students and the London Vietnamese community. We welcome not only Vietnamese students, but also anyone who is interested in celebrating the beautiful Vietnamese culture, looking for leadership opportunities, or simply, to make some wonderful new friends! From indulging in delicious food, cultural games, music, dance, and so much more at our social events, the friendships and memories you'll make at Western VSA are lifelong!
value.Summary: The Vietnamese Students' Association is an organization created to promote Vietnamese Culture, to develop social networks and to strengthen the relationship between the Vietnamese community at the University of Western Ontario and the Vietnamese comm…

value.Name: Nishang Club
value.Description: Welcome to the Nishang Club - a place where you can explore the richness and diversity of China's ancient traditions, including the four essential skills of a scholar - qin, qi, shu, hua (琴棋书画) and the beauty of Hanfu! Our club is dedicated to promoting and preserving the cultural heritage of China through a variety of events and activities. Members can participate in classes and workshops to learn how to play the guzheng (a traditional Chinese musical instrument), play Chinese chess, participate in Hanfu dress-up parties, learn about Hanfu's history and significance, and connect with other Hanfu enthusiasts. Through these experiences, members can develop a deeper understanding of China's rich cultural history and gain valuable skills that can be applied in their daily lives. We look forward to meeting you and sharing the wonders of China's ancient traditions with plenty of fascinating events.
value.Summary: Welcome to the Nishang Club - a place where you can explore the richness and diversity of China's ancient traditions, including the four essential skills of a scholar - qin, qi, shu, hua (琴棋书画) and the beauty of Hanfu!

value.Name: Association for Learning and Preserving the History of WWII in Asia
value.Description:
The Association for Learning and Preserving the History of WW2 in Asia (ALPHA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to building knowledge and understanding of WW2 in Asia through education. Our mission is to promote the learning and critical understanding of the history of WWII in Asia and the atrocities of war, to affirm the values of justice, peace and reconciliation from a humanity perspective. The Western Chapter is dedicated to pursuing ALPHA's mission to secondary and post-secondary students in the London community.


ALPHA aims to activate historical memory and dialogue, not to lay blame, but to promote reconciliation, healing, closure and cross-cultural understanding.


We achieve this mission through education and advocacy initiatives along four directions: engaging educators and students, empowering youth, supporting research, and connecting with the community.
value.Summary: The Association for Learning and Preserving the History of WW2 in Asia (ALPHA) is a non-profit organization dedicated to building knowledge and understanding of WW2 in Asia through education.

value.Name: The Crohn's and Colitis Club of Western
value.Description: The Crohn’s and Colitis Club of Western aims to raise awareness for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) and provide students with the opportunity to share their experiences and learn more about Crohn’s disease and Colitis. The Crohn’s and Colitis Club of Western will strive to provide Western University students with a means to share their ideas and stories, and provide each other with the necessary support to ensure a healthy mental and physical well-being.
value.Summary: The Crohn’s and Colitis Club of Western aims to raise awareness for Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) and provide students with the opportunity to share their experiences and learn more about Crohn’s disease and Colitis

value.Name: Nail'd It! Western Nail Art Club
value.Description:
Nail'd It! Western Nail Art Club hosts nail art sessions where we teach, paint, and party - no experience required! We have fun nights of relaxation, self-care, and stress-relief from being busy university students.

Follow us on Instagram @nailditwestern and facebook @naildituwo
value.Summary: Nail'd It! Western Nail Art Club hosts nail art sessions where we teach, paint, and party - no experience required!

value.Name: Charity Chords
value.Description:
Charity Chords!

What is Charity Chords?

CharityChords is club designed to bring together the two best things on campus: Charity and Music! Through running ridiculously fun events on and off campus, Charity Chords aims to highlight and combat important issues ranging from sustainability, to sexual violence - and many more. 

You won't wanna miss out on Charity Chords!

Catch us this year running coffee houses, talent shows, bar nights, karaoke nights, open mic nights, and more!
value.Summary: You guessed it... we perform music for charity! We run weekly Jam Nights, monthly coffee houses and talent show fundraisers, volunteering at the Ronald McDonald House, and more. Come sing, play music, perform, and support a good cause with us!

value.Name: Western Piano Society
value.Description:
Western Piano Society was founded to provide students at Western an opportunity to share their passion for piano-playing and music.

WPS activities include regular concerts where members can perform in a casual setting. Performers are encouraged to play any piece they like, be it classical, jazz, or contemporary. Members who do not wish to play, but to listen can come and enjoy the music.

Members are also provided with the opportunity to volunteer at Windermere on the Mount to play for the elderly. This is a great opportunity to perform in front of others while contributing to the community.

Lastly, the teaching program in WPS allows members who are willing to learn to be matched up with another member who is qualified to teach. Matching is based on needs and preferences. This is an excellent opportunity for those who wish to learn piano or to gain teaching experience.

Be it an opportunity to teach, a chance to learn, or a environment to relieve stress, WPS will provide it for you.
 
Follow our social media!

https://linktr.ee/westernpianosociety
value.Summary: Interested in piano or music in general? Join the Western Piano Society! ANYONE of any skill level (even no skill) is welcome! We hold concerts, offer piano lessons and volunteer as musicians in the community.

value.Name: Western Sign Language Club
value.Description:
The Sign Language Club aims to provide a place for Western students with an interest in American Sign Language (ASL) to learn and practice together. We have weekly meetings and events to help us learn not only the vocabulary and syntax of ASL, but also the history and culture associated with it. Our clubs aims to explore d/Deaf culture to better understand the community behind the language and focuses on accessibility in a collaborative-based environment using trusted resources and guest speakers. We are an open space for anyone who wants to join and learn, no matter your prior knowledge of ASL!

2023-24 Executive Team:

President: Shae Solomon

VP Communication: Mary Kolitsopoulos

VP Events: Emily Barbosa

VP Finance: Grace Zhang
value.Summary: The Western Sign Language Club aims to provide a place for Western students with an interest in ASL (American Sign Language) to learn and practice together, including beginners.

value.Name: Western Egyptian Student Association
value.Description:
Welcome to Western's Egyptian Students' Association, WESA, you’re home away from home.

Immerse yourself in the richness of Egyptian culture right on campus. Whether you're from the Land of the Pharaohs or simply fascinated by its allure, WESA is your gateway to a vibrant community that celebrates Egypt's essence.

Discover tantalizing Egyptian cuisine, mesmerizing traditional music, and genuine friendships. With engaging events and heartwarming gatherings, we infuse your journey at Western with Egypt's spirit.

Let WESA be your haven, where friendships flourish and memories form. Explore, learn, and share the magnificence of Egypt with us. Join and help paint Western with Egyptian tradition and unity.
value.Summary: Welcome to Western's Egyptian Student Association, WESA, you’re home away from home.

value.Name: Exercise is Medicine Canada on Campus at Western University
value.Description: Exercise is Medicine (EIM) Canada on Campus at Western University is an extension of Exercise is Medicine Canada, established by the Canadian Society for Exercise Physiology (CSEP). Our mission is to promote physical activity for chronic disease prevention and enhance Canadians' health while fostering a healthier campus environment at Western. By encouraging interdisciplinary partnerships through impactful events, campaigns, and dynamic speakers, we seek to positively influence healthy habits among Western University's undergraduate students.
value.Summary: Exercise is Medicine Canada on Campus at Western University aims to promote physical activity as a method of chronic disease prevention, to improve the health of Canadians and to make Western's campus a healthier place.

value.Name: Campfire Circle Western (formerly Western for Ooch)
value.Description: Campfire Circle Western is a student-run club affiliated with Campfire Circle, a camp for children with cancer. We strive to bring individuals from all different backgrounds, camp and non-camp alike, together to create a community on campus with the common goal of having fun and promoting camp spirit. Through exciting and interactive camp-themed programming like camp crafts, sing-alongs, photo booths, and more, we aim to raise funds and awareness for Campfire Circle while helping to put the camp in campus! Help us make the spirit of summer last all year :) Check out our Facebook Page: www.facebook.com/WesternForOoch Learn more about Camp Oochigeas: www.ooch.org/
value.Summary: Campfire Circle Western is a student-run club affiliated with Campfire Circle, a camp for children with cancer

value.Name: Balkan Club
value.Description: The Balkan Club strives to bring together people from land regions in Eastern Europe that are grouped together and known as the “Balkans”. Historically, these regions include the following 13 countries – Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Croatia, Greece, Kosovo, Moldova, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Romania, Serbia, Slovenia, and Turkey. The objective of the club is to provide a sense of belonging and familiarity to the Balkan Community at Western University, where students can meet, express themselves freely, and interact with others of similar interests and backgrounds, creating a home away from home for those of Balkan descent.
value.Summary: The objective of the club is to provide a sense of belonging and familiarity to the Balkan Community at Western University, where students can meet, express themselves freely, and interact with others of similar interests and backgrounds.

value.Name: Iraqi Students' Cultural Club
value.Description: The Iraqi Students’ Cultural club aims to bring Iraqi culture and its rich history to campus! We aim to bring together the Iraqis and non-Iraqis alike as a community via fun, informative events that will showcase our rich history, culture and many more!
value.Summary: The Iraqi Students’ Cultural club aims to bring Iraqi culture and its rich history to campus! We aim to bring together the Iraqis and non-Iraqis alike as a community via fun, informative events that will showcase our rich history, culture and many more!
